texts.es: Luz de 20 aos, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de sobresalir en la vida, vive en su propia casa situada en la comunidad de Bethel anexo del distrito de Quimbiri y lo que ms desea es obtener mejores ingresos para as darle una estabilidad econmica a su futura familia. Ella es una jovencita muy laboriosa, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es comerciante y tiene un paraje de abarrotes situado en su comunidad, desde entonces la bodega de Luz es muy frecuentado por sus compradores, debido a su buen trato. Su negocio esta abierto desde muy temprano hasta altas hora de la noche. Lo que ms le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 03 aos en este negocio y considera que lo ms difcil es permanecer de pie casi todo el da. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias abriendo un pequeo mini Marquet dentro de su comunidad Bethel. Este es su segundo crdito de Luz con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudar mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Se siente muy acorde trabajar con los socios de su banco comunal. Con el crdito solicitado comprara ms productos para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 20, is a single, cheerful and hard working young woman with the desire to get ahead in life. She lives in her own house located in the community of Bethel, an annex of Quimbiri District. What she most wants is to earn better income to provide economic stability to her future family.
She is a very hard working young woman; she does her best to get ahead with her work. She is a merchant. She has a grocery stand in her community. Since then her store has been very popular with buyers because of the good treatment they get. Her business is open from very early until late at night. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers since this is one of her abilities that she uses to win over larger number of consumers. Shes been in business for three years and considers the most difficult part having to be on her feet almost all day. In time, she hopes to increase her profits opening a small mini market in the community of Bethel.
This is Luzs second loan with MFP. She feels that the contribution will help her business progress very much and is willing to repay in a timely fashion. She is very agreeable to working with her fellow communal bank members. She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loan.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loan.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto, tiene 50 aos de edad, es originario de Boaco departamento ubicado en el norte del pas ,pero vive en la ciudad de Estel , de oficio comerciante el se dedica a vender herramientas de trabajo en una ferretera , esta casado , es padre de 6 hijos. Cuando el inicio este negocio tenia 38 aos de edad, su inventario en aquel entonces era muy poco, comenz con capital propio , el tuvo que vender un terreno que tenia para poder iniciar este negocio , anteriormente el venda granos bsicos pero despus decidi que vender productos para ferretera se ganaba mejor adems tenia que buscar como sacar adelante a su familia. Hoy en da su esposa lo ayuda a atender el negocio, esta ubicado en su casa de habitacin. El solicito el prstamo para compras ms inventario a su ferretera, sus ventas son muy buenas pero le hacen falta ms productos para ofrecer. Con esta inversin espera poder hacer crecer su negocio, pues podr tener mas inventario para vender, hacer mas clientes, mejorar sus ventas e ingresos tambin. Su meta prxima es expandir su negocio y ahorrar para terminar de preparar a sus hijos para que tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 50 years old, a native of Boaca department, located in the north of the country, but he lives in the city of Esteli. His trade is merchant and he sells iron work created in his hardware store. He is married and the father of 6 children.
When he began the business, he was 38 years old. His inventory in those days was very small. He began with his own capital, and had to sell a piece of land to begin the enterprise. Previously, he sold basic grains but, later, decided to sell iron products to earn more money and advance his family. Today, his wife helps him attend the business, which is located in his house of residence.
Rigoberto is requesting a loan to buy more inventory for his hardware store. His sales are very good but he lacks more products to offer. With this investment, he hopes to expand his business. With more inventory to sell he will gain customers and improve both sales and income.
His immediate goals are to expand his business and save money in order to prepare his children for a university education.

loan.use: buy more inventory for his hardware store.

loan.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa, vive nicamente con su esposo, se dedica a atender una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, existe desD. hace 20 aos, lo heredo D. sus padres, y en la actualidad lo atienD. todos los das. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra D. arroz, aceite, azcar, frijol, huevos y mas, productos que son demandados a diario por los clientes, esta ser una gran ayuda para los clientes ya que encontraran en su tienda, todo lo necesario para el hogar. Su aspiracin es trabajar por tener ingresos que le ayuden a vivir cmodamente con su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with just her husband. Her business is serving in a store selling basic household products. She has owned the store for 20 years and inherited it from her parents. She currently works in the store every day.
Rosa is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, eggs and other products that her customers ask for daily. This will be a great help for her customers as they will be able to find everything they need for their households in her store.
Rosa's aspiration is to work so that she can make enough profits for herself and her husband to live comfortably.

loan.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans and eggs

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: buy more beauty products to supply her business.

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel owns Brilliant Elegance, a company offering window-cleaning services to businesses and private residences. He opened Brilliant Elegance five years ago, after he and his wife moved from Idaho to Mission, Texas, so they could be closer to her family. Before owning Brilliant Elegance, Samuel worked as the CFO for an optometrists office. Dissatisfied with the long hours and low pay, Samuel wanted to position himself strategically so that his hard work would translate into financial independence. At the time, he was washing windows on the weekends for additional income, so he began exploring the possibility of converting this weekend job into a full-time business. It was important that he open a business with minimal startup cost, so Samuel thoroughly researched the industry and wrote a business plan budgeting estimated costs and revenues. Seeing excellent potential for profitability, he opened Brilliant Elegance and never looked back.
His clients come in all shapes and sizes -- from restaurant chains, to grocery stores, to private residences. Until now, Samuel has typically worked alone and only hired additional workers as needed. However, in order to meet a growing workload and facilitate further expansion, Samuel is hiring 3-4 full-time employees. This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana provides him the capital to hire these employees and helps him cover payroll over the next couple of months. Typically, Samuel must wait up to 60 days before his new business accounts begin paying him, so he anticipates this expansion to strain his cash flow temporarily.
A constant challenge for Samuel has been maintaining contracts with clients affected by the recession, because his services are among the first cut by businesses looking to reduce costs. Samuel says that one of his clients, a national restaurant chain, discontinued his services to save money and transferred the responsibility of washing windows to their employees. However, after just two weeks, they realized that they couldnt maintain the windows at the level Samuel did and that their restaurants appearance was suffering as a result. So, they called Samuel back and renewed his contract. He says that his key to success is showing clients how his services add value to their business by creating an atmosphere that is appealing to customers.
In the future, Samuel wants to expand his business to other markets in Texas as well as move into lateral industries like janitorial services, asphalt and line painting repairs, as well as general building maintenance. For the time being, though, he remains focused on growing his accounts in the greater-Mission area.

loan.use: to hire new employees and expand business

loan.name: Karen Narobia

texts.en: Karen, 26 years old, started her business of selling clothes and cosmetics door-to-door approximately three years ago with the help of a small loan from her grandmother. Since that time, Karen has built up a strong client base and her business has grown steadily. With the increased demand for her products, Karen plans to use the proceeds from this loan to update and increase her inventory so that her business can continue to expand.

loan.use: to update and increase her inventory

loan.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es madre de familia de 47 aos de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mrrope, que se encuentra a una hora de distancia aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque. El distrito es una zona turstica, agrcola y ganadera.
Lucinda se dedica a la crianza y comercializacin de animales de corral, desde hace 5 aos aproximadamente, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo. Otra actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, con los ingresos que logre obtner por la venta de los mismos podra solventar sus obligaciones familiares.
A solicitado un crdito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para continuar comprando animales, arreglar su corral y para la compra de productos para implementar su negocio, las ganancias que logre recaudar ser para pagar su prstamo y poder sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a 47-year old mother who lives with her husband and children in her own home, which only has electrical service. It is located in the Mrrope district, located approximately one hours distance from the department of Lambayeque. The district is a zone that is known for its tourism, agriculture and livestock.
Lucinda has dedicated herself to raising and selling farm animals for about 5 years. Her corral is located behind her house. She gives her animals balanced feed and natural grasses and, once they are the ideal size, she sells them at the market in Lambayeque and Chiclayo. Another activity she carries out is selling basic products from her house. With the income she manages to obtain from her sales, she will be able to meet the familys obligations.
She has requested a loan of 1,000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to continue buying animals, fix her corral, and to buy products to supply her business. The earnings she makes will be to repay her loan and to help her family get ahead.

loan.use: buy more farm animals, repair her corral, and supply her general store with products.

loan.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es: La seora Eulogia tiene 53 aos de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella ya que es menor de edad y aun esta estudiando. Luego de fallecer su esposo ella tuvo que salir a trabajar para poder sustentar a sus hijos, vende anticuchos y mollejitas por la noche en la entrada de la zona en la que vive asi mismo vende golosinas en los locales donde realizan fiestas patronales. Su prestamo actual lo utilizara para invertir en su negocio. Su deseo es poder tener un local propio en donde poder ofrecer sus ricos anticuchos
texts.en:
Eulogia is 53 years old. She is a widow and has six children. Only one of her children is dependent on her as he is still a child and in school. After her husband died, Eulogia had to go out to work in order to support her children. She sells kebabs and sweetbreads in the evening at the entrance to the area where she lives. She also sells candies in places where they are celebrating town festivals.
Eulogia will use this loan to invest in her business. Her wish is to own her own premises where she can sell her delicious kebabs.

loan.use: to invest in buying merchandise

loan.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Sandra, vive con un hijo, ella se dedica a vender productos cosmticos por revista, esta venta la realiza de forma ambulante, por los caseros cercanos a su vivienda. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de productos cosmticos y medicinas para ofrecer a los clientes, el crdito le ayudara para mejorar el inventario de los productos. Su sueo es que a travs del trabajo, logre algn da comprarse una casa donde vivir segura con su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her son. Her business is selling cosmetics through a catalog. She makes her sales door to door in the small villages near her home. She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and medicines to sell to her customers. The loan will help her to improve her stock of products.
Sandra's dream is to be able to some day buy a house, through her work, where she can live safely with her son.

loan.use: to buy cosmetics (make-up, creams, lipsticks) and medicines

loan.name: Los Chupaquinitos Group

texts.es: La Seora Haydee tiene 35 aos de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo menor en etapa escolar, Haydee es socia de la alcancia comunal los "Chupaquinitos", se dedica a la compra y venta de animal vacuno en pie, ella se traslada durante las semanas en las diferentes ferias de su centro poblado para realizar la compra de animales y revender a los carniceros y asi generar sus propios ahorros para su canasta familiar y para los gastos de estudio de su hijo. Solicito el prstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, el prestamo lo utilizara para la compra de insumos de engorde y alimentacion para el ganado. la Sra. Haydee se encuentra al centro de las dos seoras de la foto principal esta con chompa de color gris.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old. She is a single mother and has one son who is in school. She is a member of "Los Chupaquinitos" community bank and her business is buying and selling cattle. During the week, she travels to the different livestock markets in her area to buy animals and re-sell to butchers. In this way, she makes her own savings with which to cover her family's basic expenses and also her son's educational expenses.
Haydee requested this loan to increase her working capital and will use the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her cattle. Haydee is located in the center of the two women in the main picture and is wearing a gray sweatshirt.

loan.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her cattle

loan.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Mara tiene 30 aos de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio slo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mrrope que se encuentra a 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque. Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrcola, ganadera y turismo (tiene festividades religiosas muy bonitas).
Mara es comerciante desde hace muchos aos de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ptimo para qu pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y as obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Ha solicitado un prstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar ms animales y arreglar sus corral, con la finalidad de que con los ingresos que obtenga pueda brindarlea su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Mara es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades familiares y brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Mara is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house, which only has the service of electricity. It is located in the district of Mrrope, which can be found 40 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. This zone is dedicated to activities related to farming, livestock and tourism (they have beautiful religious festivals).
Mara has been a livestock merchant for many years (cows). Her corral is located outside her house, and she gives them balanced feed and natural grasses so they will grow optimally. She offers them throughout the various markets in the zone, and that is how she generates good profits to meet the household expenses.
She has requested a loan of 3000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy more animals and make repairs to her corral. The end result hopefully being that, with the earnings she obtains, she will be able to provide a higher standard of living for her family. Mara is a very responsible and hard-working woman who worries about improving her business and continuing to meet the familys needs. She wants to give her children other opportunities in life.

loan.use: buy more animals and make repairs to her corral.

loan.name: Danilo Santiago

texts.en: Danilo Santiago is a 36-year-old married father of three children, ages 4, 9, and 12. He owns a small tailoring business that produces various types of clothing. The loan will be used to buy additional fabric to produce more clothes and grow the business. Danilo Santiagos dream is to be able to support and ultimately provide a better life for his family.

loan.use: to buy additional fabric to produce more clothes and grow the business

loan.name: Veronica Roxana

texts.es: Vernica, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella tiene un ciber y tambin venD. productos varios, tiene cuatro aos D. estar al frente del negocio, ella es una profesional en computacin, por lo que se le hizo fcil montar el negocio. Ella solicita un prstamo para actualizar y dar mantenimiento a las maquinas, ya que con este proceso estar mejorando el rendimiento y el servicio del ciber. Su objetivo es mantenerse en el negocio, poco a poco ir aumentado el nmero D. computadoras y D. igual manera mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Vernica lives with her husband and son. She owns an Internet cafe and also sells a variety of products. She has been running her business for four years. Vernica is an IT professional and so she found it easy to set up her business.
Vernica is requesting a loan to upgraD. and have maintenance work done on her machines since this will help improve their performance and thereby the service she provides in her Internet cafe.
Vernica's goal is to keep running her business and gradually increase her number of computers. She also hopes to improve her family income.

loan.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her machines

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy footwear, perfume, sheets, towels and clothes in general.

loan.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 10 aos de edad, se dedica a la venta de meriendas y tortillas, tiene 6 aos de trabajar con este negocio que hasta hoy ha sido la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para apoyarse junto a su esposo y juntos velar por las necesidades del hogar. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de ingredientes para las meriendas como: pollo, carnes, frijoles, arroz, aceite y condimentos, tambin maz para las tortillas, con esta ayuda contara con todo lo necesario para su negocio. El objetivo de Teresa es que a travs de su esfuerzo, sus hijos puedan estudiar y preparase para mejorar sus oportunidades.
texts.en:
Teresa lives together with her husband and two children aged 13 and 10. Her business is selling snacks and tortillas. She has been working in this business for six years and it has been the source of income with which she has supported her family, together with her husband's help.
Teresa is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making her snacks such as chicken, meat, beans, rice, oil and condiments. She will also buy corn for making her tortillas. With this help, she will have everything she needs for her business.
Teresa's goal is to work hard so that her children can study and prepare themselves in order to improve their opportunities.

loan.use: to buy chicken, meat, beans, rice, oil, condiments and corn

loan.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las Estrellitas y se Ubica en la localidad de Tecpatan estado de Chiapas, la seora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Matilde es madre soltera y su responsabilidad tiene dos hijos: Erlin de veinte aos, Yessenia Guadalupe de quince aos.
Ella se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboracin de hamacas, para luego venderlo en la misma localidad y as tambin vender trastes de tupper, en donde lleva quince aos, lo que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Aprendi esta actividad con su mama ya que ella tambin se dedicaba a lo mismo y desde muy joven aprendi y cuando se caso dejo de practicarlo, pero para apoyar a su esposo comenz de nuevo as los dos sacar adelante a sus hijos que estaban creciendo quien desafortunada mente la abandono hace unos aos, pero aun as ella sigue trabajando.
Su ms grande deseo es que con esta actividad y el prstamo pueda seguir trabajando para que con ello logre tener ahorros para apoyar seguir apoyando a sus hijos que estn estudiando.
Los dems integrantes del grupo son: Irma quien se dedica a la compra de maz para la elaboracin de tascalate, pinol, y tambin la venta de refresco, la seora blanca luz: quien invierte el prstamo en la compra de mercanca para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, Jorge Antonio se dedica a la copra y venta de pollos de rancho para criarlo y luego venderlo, as tambin la seora Bertha que invierte el prstamo en la compra de pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliado.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Estrellitas (The Little Stars) and is located in Tecpatan, Chiapas. The woman who gave the interview is Matilde. Shes a single mother with two children in her care: Erlin, 20, and Yessenia Guadalupe, 15.
She buys cordage to make hammocks that she resells in her same location. She also sells Tupperware. Shes been in business 15 years and she comments that she does well because its allowed her to provide her children with schooling.
She learned this occupation with her mother since she was in the same line of work and she learned while still very young. When she got married she stopped doing it but, in order to help out her husband, she started up again so that together they could raise their children who were growing. Unfortunately, he left her a few years ago but even so she continues to work.
Her greatest wish is that with this activity and the loan she will be able to continue to work so that she can manage to have some savings to continue supporting her children who are still studying.
The other group members are: Irma, who buys and sells corn to make tascalate and pinol (traditional corn-based beverages from Chiapas) and also sells soft drinks, Blanca Luz, who will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store, Jorge Antonio who buys and sells free range chickens to raise and later sell and Bertha who will use the loan to buy free range chickens to later sell butchered.

loan.use: to pay for cordage to make hammocks.

loan.name: Cuanicuti Group

texts.es: La seora Judith es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora ella es originaria del Distrito Federal, pero se fue a vivir desde hace 15 aos a la poblacin de Zitacuaro Michoacn por que a su esposo le ofrecieron un mejor trabajo en esa poblacin. Ella esta casada con el seor Ernesto el cual es Chef, ellos tienen dos hijos un joven de 17 aos estudiante de preparatoria y una nia de 8 aos estudiante de primaria. ella se dedica hacer banquetes para fiestas como quince aos, bautizos, presentaciones, bodas, cumpleaos etc. y repostera para vender a sus clientes, ella hace piernas de pavo, lomos, pavos, ensaladas, sopas, pastas, postres, comenta que quien le enseo hacer todo esto fue su esposo ya que el se haba quedado sin trabajo y decidieron hacer este negocio ellos dos. Comenta que ella hace cada tercer da empanadas rellenas de comida o de mermeladas, bisquets, pays, y ya le gente le manda hacer pedidos. Comenta que ella esta pidiendo un prstamo para comprar la materia prima para hacer sus comidas y sus postres para venderlos, dice que surte todos los productos en diferentes tiendas de su poblacin, tambin comenta que desgraciadamente no ha podido crecer su negocio tan rpido ya que las rentas son muy caras y ya hay mucha competencia en su poblacin. La meta que tiene Judith es hacer un local propio en cual pueda poner su negocio estable y as tendra ms clientes. Los dems integrantes del grupo se llaman Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia, Enriqueta y ven a ocupar sus prestamos para invertir en sus actividades econmicas como papelera, venta de cosmticos por catalogo, venta de ropa usada, tienda de ropa nueva, zapatos por catalogo, tienda de abarrotes etc.
texts.en:
Judith is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. She is originally from Distrito Federal but 15 years ago she moved to the town of Zitacuaro, in Michoacn, because her husband was offered a better job in that town. Judith is married to Ernesto who is a chef. They have two children: a young boy of 17 who is in high school and an 8 year-old girl who is in elementary school.
Judith's business is catering for events such as 15th birthday celebrations, christenings, society debuts, weddings, birthdays etc. She also bakes pastries to sell to her customers. She prepares turkey legs, fillet steaks, turkeys, salads, soups, pastas and desserts. She tells us that it was her husband who taught her how to do all this since he had lost his job and they decided to set up this business between the two of them.
Judith tells us that every three days she makes empanadas, jellies, biscuits and pies, and people also make orders with her. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the raw materials she needs to make the food and desserts that she sells. She says that she stocks up with products in the different stores in her town. She also says that, unfortunately, she has not been able to grow her business so quickly because her rent is very expensive and there is a lot of competition in her town.
Judith's goal is to own her own premises where she can set up a stable business and thereby have more customers. The other members of her group are called Araceli, Manuel, Decire, Minerva, Fabiola, Blanca, Melina, Nadia and Enriqueta. They will invest their loans in their respective business activities which include a stationery store, selling cosmetics through a catalog, selling used clothes, a [new] clothes store, selling shoes through a catalog and running a grocery store.

loan.use: to buy supplies for her catering business

loan.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es: La seora Petra Constantina es integrante del grupo Virgen de Juquila, se encuentra en Cohuecan, Puebla, Mxico, las integrantes del grupo son las seoras Ernestina, Petra Constantina, Maura y Manuelas van a comprar con su prstamo barro y lea para elaborar sus jarros, ollas, platos, cazuelas y pedestales, la seorita Luisa va a comprar barro, lea y pinturas para elaborar ollas, cazuelas y platos, la seora Diana va a comprar medicamentos analgsicos, antibiticos, gasas, etc. La seora Gabina va a comprar barro y tierra blanca para elaborar platos y tazas, el seor Guillermo va a comprar llantas y mantenimiento para su taxi para dar un mejor servicio. La seora Petra Constantina tiene 65 aos de edad ella es casada tiene 2 hijos Maura de 38 aos de edad y Sebastin de 16 aos de edad ya trabaja, ella se dedica a la alfarera, ella solicito su prstamo para comprar barro para elaborar ollas y jarros los vende a sus clientes crudos, ella inicio su negocio cuando se caso con lo que le daba su esposo fue ahorrando para comprar el barro y fue con una vecina para que le enseara a trabajar el barro, actualmente su hija le ayuda a elaborar las ollas y los jarros, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo y tiene dinero para la familia, ella est orgullosa de elaborar los jarros y las ollas y le gusta cuando las vende y tiene dinero, ella se siete contenta y feliz con este prstamo que va a recibir porque va poder comprar su material y tener en existencia para ir trabajando y otra parte la va a ahorrar, sus sueos y esperanzas son tener salud junto con la familia para vivir contentos. San Bartolo Cohuecan es un pueblo bonito siembran de temporal sorgo y maz, celebran el 24 de agosto al patrono del pueblo San Bartolo hay muchos visitantes, hay feria, misas, comida para los visitante. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacin Realidad gracias por sus prstamos porque nos ayudan mucho en los negocios y que nos bajen el inters
texts.en:
Petra Constantina is a member of the Virgen de Juquila group, which is in Cohuecan, Puebla, Mexico. Ernestina, Petra Constantina, Maura and Manuelas are members of the group. With their loan they are going to buy clay and firewood to make their jars, pots, pans, and stands.
Luisa will buy clay, firewood, and paints to make pots, pans, and plates.
Diana will buy analgesic medications, antibiotics, and gauze, etc.
Gabina will buy clay and white sandy soil to make plates and cups.
Guillermo will buy tires and pay for maintenance on his taxi in order to offer better service.
Petra Constantina, age 65, is married and has two children. Maura is 38 years old, and Sebastian is 16 years old and works. She devotes herself to making pottery. She requested her loan in order to buy clay to make pots and jars. She sells them to her customers unglazed.
She started her business when she got married. She was saving the money her husband gave her in order to buy clay. She went to a neighbor to learn to work the clay. Currently he daughter helps her make the pots and jars. Her business is important because she has work and money for her family. She is proud of making the jars and pots. She likes it when she sells them and has money. She is content and happy with the loan that she will receive because she will be able to buy her material and have it in stock in order to keep working. She will save the other part of the loan.
Her hopes and dreams are to have good health together with her family in order to live happily.
San Bartolo Cohuecan is a pretty town where seasonal sorghum and corn is grown. The 24th of August they celebrate the patron saint of the town of San Bartolo. There are a lot of visitors, a fair, masses, and food for the visitors.
The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundacin Realidad, Thanks for the loans because they help us a lot in our businesses and that they lower our interest.

loan.use: to buy clay to make jars and pots.

loan.name: Americanistas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Americanistas se llama as porque la mayora de los integrantes son aficionados al equipo de ftbol America, este grupo esta integrado por 9 personas que de dedican al trabajo diario para el sustento de su familia Lourdes (Venta de ropa), Hortencia (Elaboracin de bolsas bordadas), Hilaria y Guillermo (Venta de abarrotes), Sofa (Venta de catalogo), Reyna y Juana (Venta de calzado), Adela (Venta de Herbalife), Juan (Taller de serigrafa). Hilaria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, esta casada con el seor Navor, tiene una pequea hija. Ella solicito el prstamo porque quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de aborreces en su casa ya que por donde vive no existe ningn otro negocio de abarrotes y pens que es una buena opcin para pueda tener un nuevo ingreso para la aportacin en su familia, con el crdito comprara: jabn, aceite, papel higinico, detergente, azcar, entre otros productos. Hilaria decidi iniciar este negocio porque con lo que su esposo gana no le alcanza para los gastos y como su pequea hija necesita de muchas cosas a veces no tiene para comprrselas y espera que con este pequeo negocio obtenga ganancias para as poder comprarle todo lo que su hija necesita. Hilaria comenta que antes de que se casara ella se dedicaba a la elaboracin de pan pero cuando conoci a su esposo dejo de hacerlo. Su meta es hacer su propia casa ya que donde vive es de su suegra, y lo piensa lograr con esfuerzo y dedicacin Esta muy contenta por el crdito otorgado y agradece por este gran apoyo.
texts.en:
This group is called the Americanistas because most of the members are fans of the soccer team, America. The group is made up of 9 people who work every day to support their families. Lourdes (clothing sales), Hortencia (makes embroidered bags), Hilaria and Guillermo (grocery sales), Sofia (catalog sales), Reyna and Juana (shoes sales), Adela (Herbalife sales), and Juan (a silkscreen shop).
Hilaria is one of the members of this group. She is married to Navor and she has a little daughter. She is requesting the loan because she wants to start a business of selling groceries in her home since there is no other where she lives, She thought it would be a good option so she could have another source of income for her family. She will use the loan to buy: soap, oil, toilet paper, detergent, sugar and more. Hilaria decided to begin this business because her husband doesnt earn enough to cover the expenses and because her little daughter needs many things and she isnt able to buy all of them. Hilaria says that before she was married, she made bread but she stopped once she met her husband. Her goal is to have her own house since now she lives with her mother-in-law and she plans to succeed with effort and dedication. She is very happy with the loan offered and she appreciates the support.

loan.use: To buy grocieries such as detergent, toilet paper, sugar, oil, etc

loan.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia tiene su negocio de venta de tortillas. Hace ms de 35 aos que tiene este negocio, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su negocio. El motivo del crdito es para la compra de maz, bolsas, comal y cal. Inicio este negocio gracias a su esposo y que le ha brindado mucho ayuda. Maria siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles a sus clientes buena calidad en sus productos y un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mara Antonias business is selling tortillas. Shes been in business for over 35 years. She is a very enterprising person who enjoys her business. The reason for the loan is to buy corn, bags, a griddle and lime powder. She started the business thanks to her husband who has provided much support to her. Mara has always stood out for providing her customers with good quality products and good service.

loan.use: to buy corn, bags, a griddle and lime powder.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy seafood (shrimp, lobster, fish).

loan.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.en: Manuel Antonio is a single father of four who has a small business selling firewood. After learning the business from his brothers, he has operated on his own for the last twenty years. He has established a strong client base and has been able to support his family. Manuel Antonio plans to use the loan to purchase more inventory and grow his business. His dream is to purchase a new vehicle, which would be helpful not only personally, but also for business reasons.

loan.use: to purchase more firewood to sell and grow his business

loan.name: Seor De Wimpillay Chocco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Seor De Wimpillay Chocco y se renen cada treinta das en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Santiago en el populoso barrio de Winpillay (Cusco, Per). El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora, profesionales, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo est conformado por doce integrantes y son varias vez que solicitan un prstamo de la Asociacin Arariwa y invertirn el dinero para mejorar sus negocios.
En esta reunin conocimos a la seora Isabel y nos cuenta que vive en el barrio de Winpillay de la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Isabel tiene una pequea tienda de comestibles en su domicilio donde vende sus productos a costos accesibles para sus clientes. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el prstamo para comprar ms mercadera as poder abastecer su tienda y surtir de diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo leche en tarros. Ella tiene 43 aos, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso da con da, siempre con el deseo de brindarles lo mejor a su familia. El sueo de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Seor De Wimpillay Chocco and it meets every thirty days in Cuscos Santiago district, in a crowded neighborhood called Wimpillay (Cusco, Per). The communal bank stands out for being composed of hard working people, professionals, artisans and merchants. The group has 12 members and they have asked for several loans from Asociacin Arariwa. They will use the money to improve their businesses.
We met Isabel at the meeting. She told us that she lives in Cuscos Wimpillay neighborhood with her spouse and three children. Since a very young age she distinguished herself by being a very responsible and kind person and because of this her neighbors invited her to participate in the communal bank.
Isabel has a small grocery store at home where she sells items at accessible prices to her customers. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store and have different basic need items on hand, for example, jars of milk.
She is 43 years old and is a person with a strong desire for self improvement and to have a business that succeeds every day always with the intention of providing the best for her family. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loan.use: to buy more merchandise, like jugs of milk, for example.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, vegetables, oil and condiments

loan.name: Blanca Yadira

texts.es: La Seora Blanca Yadira tiene 40 aos. Blanca es casada. Tienen 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad econmica es venta de mercadera en general. Hace ms de 10 aos que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con productos pequeos ropa para nios, sabanas y otros productos, por lo que decide incursionar comprando ms mercadera como es a ropa de adultos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, sabanas, cosmticos y ropa en general. El sueo de Blanca es diversificar en sus productos y ofrecer un sin nmero de productos.
texts.en:
Blanca Yadira is 40 years old. Shes married and has one child in her care. She sells general merchandise. Shes been in this business for over ten years. She started out with small items, childrens clothes, sheets and other things and later decided to start buying other merchandise like clothes for adults.
The loan shes asking for is to use as working capital to buy clothes, footwear, sheets, cosmetics and clothes in general. Blancas dream is to diversify her products and offer countless products.

loan.use: to buy clothes, footwear, sheets, cosmetics and clothes in general.

loan.name: Sonia Lilliam

texts.en: Sonia Liliam is a 71-year-old woman who has operated a door-to-door food vending business for the last nine years. Her merchandise includes basic grains, milk, meat, and other food products. Sonia Liliam started her business with her own funds and assistance from her son. She is very proud of the fact that through her hard work over the years, she has been able to buy her own house. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise that Sonia Liliam will then be able to sell. Her dream is for her grandchildren to have a future full of opportunities.

loan.use: to buy more merchandise to sell

loan.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es: La Seora Gloria Argentina tiene 36 aos. Ella es una mujer muy alegre, a pesar de las dificultades que ha atravesado siempre ha mantenido su espritu de entusiasmo y esto es lo le ha ayudado con su actividad econmica es su brindar el servicio de costura. Hace ms de 10 aos que tiene de dedicarse a este negocio. A Gloria siempre le ha gustado su actividad econmica ya que le gusta interactuar con la gente. Por lo que es una persona que le gusta el progreso. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en la compra de zipper, hilos, agujas, tijeras y telas.
texts.en: Gloria Argentina is 36 years old. Shes a very cheerful woman despite the difficulties shes gone through. Shes always kept an enthusiastic spirit and this has helped her in her economic activity which is providing sewing services. Shes been in this occupation for over 10 years. Gloria has always enjoyed her work because she likes interacting with people. Shes a person who likes to make progress. Because of that shes asking for this loan to buy zippers, thread, needles, scissors and fabric.

loan.use: to buy zippers, thread, needles, scissors and fabric.

loan.name: Jose Vitelio

texts.es: Jos, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de dos aos, l se dedica a la agricultura, lo inicio cuando era joven y ayudaba a su padre, aprendi el proceso y hoy en da es el trabajo que le ayuda para darle a su familia la alimentacin, los cultivos los realiza en terreno alquilado, no tiene un horario fijo. El solicita un prstamo para la compra de insumos agrcolas, preparara la tierra, e iniciar la siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, esta compra le permitir trabajar adecuadamente y realizar el cultivo con la esperanza de obtener una buena cosecha. Los sueos de Jos son crecer y obtener una buena cosecha, para poder comercializar una parte y otra para el consumo de la familia.
texts.en:
Jos is a farmer who lives with his wife and 2 year-old son. He started farming when he was young and used to help his father. He learned the process and now this is the work that helps him to feed his family. He grows his crops on rented land and doesn't work fixed hours.
Jos is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, prepare his land and start sowing his crops. He will buy manure and fertilizers. This purchase will allow him to work properly and grow his crops in the hope of obtaining a good harvest.
Jos's dreams are to grow and obtain a good harvest. He will sell some of his crops and the rest will be eaten by his family.

loan.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loan.name: Rommel David

texts.en:
Roomel David is married with two children, ages 7 and 14. For the last ten years he has owned and operated a jewelry making business. After working for another jeweler years ago, Roomel David saved his earnings and bought a spot for his own shop in the central market where he can create and sell his jewelry. The loan proceeds will be used to buy additional materials to make more products to sell.
Roomel Davids dream is to construct a house on a piece of land he already owns and to provide a bright future for his children.

loan.use: to buy additional materials to make more products to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more merchandise.

loan.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.en: Dolores is a 65-year-old grandmother who helps support her daughter and two grandchildren who live with her. She has been very successful selling cosmetics door-to-door and plans to use the loan proceeds to buy more merchandise to maintain and ultimately grow her business. Her dream is that her grandchildren will have all the opportunities they would want as they grow up.

loan.use: to buy more merchandise.

loan.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.en: Rosa Argentina is a married mother of one child who owns a small business offering perfumes, cosmetics, and clothes among other items. She started this business with her own capital six years ago when she saw an opportunity in the market for such goods. With the funds from this loan, Rosa Argentina plans to buy more merchandise to grow her business.

loan.use: buy more merchandise to sell

loan.name: Carmen Isolda

texts.en: Carmen Isolda is 24 years old. She has a business selling a variety of clothes. Through her hard work, her door-to-door selling has been very successful. She has recently secured a spot in the new market and will use the funds from this loan to open her shop there. Her goal is to continue to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

loan.use: open a new shop at the market

loan.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: La Seora Irma tiene 35 aos D. edad, socia D. la alcancia comunal mujeres emprendedoras, es casada con 3 hijos en la etapa escolar, actualmente tiene una tienda D. productos D. abarrotes y otros, la socia realiza las compras a tempranas horas D. la maana para dedicarse durante el da a la atencin D. su bodega. El Prstamo solicito es para la compra D. una vitrina y exhibicin D. los chocolates, galletas, caramelos, bebidas etc. La socia esta ubicada al centro D. las socias esta vestido con chompa color rosada. El Prstamo Solicito D. s/.1,000.00 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Irma, 35, is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) communal bank. She is married and has three, school age children. She has a store where she sells groceries and other items. She does her purchases early in the morning so that she can tend to her store the rest of the day.
She requested the loan to buy a display case to display her chocolates, cookies, candy, beverages, etc.
In the photo, shes in the center of the members wearing a pink sweater. The loan she asked for is for 1000 new soles.

loan.use: to buy a display case.

loan.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 45 years old, and is a married woman with eight children. Her husband is a farmer.
Diosa buys bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes from farmers and then sells the products at her town's local market. Diosa has been in this business for two years. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from it. She has applied for a loan and plans to use it to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as banana and cassava.
Diosa hopes for her business to prosper. She also hopes to send all her children to school.

loan.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as bananas and cassava

loan.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is 25 years old and married. She has two children, aged 3 and 2.
Lorina is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice to sell. Lorina has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loan.name: Rojica

texts.en:
Rojica is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is only 6 years old. Rojica is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She grows rice, and her harvest is for selling and family consumption. Rojica also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs to sell at the market.
Rojica's loan will be used to buy piglets, feeds and fertilizers. She will also pay rent for the tractor she used in tilling her land.
In the future, Rojica hopes to have a prosperous business. She also hopes to see all her children succeed.

loan.use: to buy piglets, feeds and fertilizers and to pay rent for the tractor

loan.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Timotea earns a living through buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for four years. Timotea buys and sells bananas, cassava and taro. She earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from this business.
Timotea's loan will be used to buy more vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, bananas and more. She hopes for this loan to help improve her earnings. She also hopes to earn better and send her four children to school.

loan.use: to buy more vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, bananas and more.

loan.name: San Judas Group

texts.es: La seora Consuelo, vive en Tecpatan Chiapas, un lugar muy bonito por el rio que atraviesa la localidad. Ella es casada y a su responsabilidad tiene dos hijos, Pedro de diesi ocho aos en sexto semestre de preparatoria y Emir de diez aos en cuarto de primaria. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de trastes por catalogo de la marca tupper ware y productos como son: labiales, maquillajes, perfumes, entre otros, de la marca, jafra y blondi, en donde lleva cuatro aos y ocho meses, de lo que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha estado teniendo un buen .resultado de su actividad. Inicio con este trabajo por una compaera quien es la que representa un grupo de jafra y la invito a formar parte de ello as tener un trabajo que le deje ganancias y sus ingresos sea ms concreto para as solventar sus gastos. Su ms grande sueo es que con esta actividad pueda tener ms ingresos en su hogar as seguir apoyando a sus hijos que estn estudiando y logren tener una carrera. En ello estn integradas dos seora mas y son: la seora Mara, quien se dedica a la elaboracin de comidas y solicito el prstamo para la compra de ingredientes, as tambin se integra la seora Mara flor de luz: ella invertir en una nueva actividad que es el de compra y venta de refresco.
texts.en:
Sra. Consuelo lives in Tecpatan Chiapas, a beautiful place that has a river than runs through the town. She is married and responsible for two children. Pedro, age 16, is in his sixth semester of preparatory school. Emir is 10 years old and in the fourth grade.

Consuelo buys and sells utensils through Tupperware catalogs. She also sells lipsticks, makeup, perfumes, and other products manufactured by the Jafra and Blondi brands. Consuelo has been in business for four years and eight months. She says that she has done very well in her business and has achieved good results.

Consuelo started her business with a colleague who works as a representative for Jafra. She was invited to be part of her team, thereby giving her a job where she could earn income and establish a more concrete revenue stream to help cover her expenses. Her greatest wish is to generate more household income from her business. She hopes to continue supporting her children with their education so that they can obtain a degree.

The other two ladies in this group are as follows: Sra. Mara prepares food and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients. Sra. Mara Flor de Luz will invest in a new business of buying and selling soft drinks.

loan.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and beauty products of various brands.

loan.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 41-year-old mother who insisted on helping her retired husband support their family of eight persons. After her husband retired from the military, he start working as a farm keeper but instead of getting a salary they agreed with the farm owner to rent the farm so they could plant some trees and have some sheep to raise. On the farm, they now have olive trees and peach trees; depending on the season, Fatmeh also makes yogurt and butter from the sheep milk. They sell it all. Now Fatmeh has applied for a loan to buy a machine that can help increase her productivity and make cheese.
Since Fatmeh is a conservative person, her husband Hussien appears in the picture.

loan.use: To buy a machine to make yogurt and cheese.

loan.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 3 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, vegetables and bananas, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his bodaboda (bicycle) transport business. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 5 months and 6 years.
Caleb has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase chickens and chicken feed. He believes that, by venturing into poultry farming, his income will increase and this will enable him to afford a quality life for his family. His main fear is the common poultry disease in the area, which results in huge losses when it strikes. However, he is optimistic that his poultry farm will expand in future and he will be able increase his production of eggs.
He comments that Juhudi does a good job for the farmers.

loan.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loan.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom has a mixed farm that produces milk, maize, beans and fruits, which are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for three years now. He also owns a mini bakery and sells fish to the local market. He is aged 39, married and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school.
Tom has requested a loan of 41,600KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that, with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and for selling. The proceeds from this loan will help him provide his children with a good education.
His biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed, especially during the dry spell. He hopes that in the next 5 years, he will have acquired at least 5 dairy cows in order to boost his milk production. He comments that Juhudi should hold frequent seminars for clients like the one held in Kitale town in January 2011.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is aged 49 and married. He has two adult children. Benson has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and employs one farmhand. His farm is currently producing milk, maize, vegetables and beans, which he sells to the local market. He also owns a motorbike that provides transport services to the local people.
Benson has made a loan request of 62,400 KES through Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that, with the dairy cow he will acquire, his milk production will increase and this will increase his income as well. The extra proceeds from this loan will help him to improve his family's livelihood.
He faces the challenge of lack of enough dairy feed, which affects his production. He plans to improve his dairy farming in future by increasing the number of his dairy cows.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is a 63-year-old farmer from the village of Boslebi, Dmanisi District. He is married and lives with his wife Naziko. Misha is machine-operator by profession and works in his and nearby villages. In addition to his main profession, Misha also runs a family agricultural farm. The family has a plot of the land where potatoes, wheat, haricot and maize are grown. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold locally to the retailers.
The requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds. Misha will fertilize the plot and sow the potatoes. According to Mishas estimations, after fertilizing he will get high quality vegetables and corn and will sell them for a good price. It will improve the income of the family. This increase will be used for renovation of the house and improvement of their living conditions.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds

loan.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 45 years old and married. He lives in the village of Didi Dmanisi, Dmanisi District. Zurab lives with his wife Khatuna, 19- and 17-year old sons, 15-year-old daughter and parents. Khatuna is a housewife; all three children go to school. Zurab leads the family agricultural farm; he grows potatoes, maize and haricot on the family-owned plot of land. Zurab trades the vegetables. He sells his own vegetables and also some other cultures, purchased in neighbor villages. The total average income of the family is 900 Laris per month.
With the requested credit, Zurab will purchase fertilizers and pay for the fuel for his tractor to till the land. Zurab hopes that after fertilizing the land, the harvested vegetables will be of a good quality and will be sold for a good price.
The profit received from the farm will be used for the education of the children.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel for his tractor

loan.name: Anzor

texts.en:
Anzor is a farmer from the village of Bolojauri, South Georgia. He is 53 years old and lives with his family: his wife Nana, his 27- and 23-year old sons, 14-year-old daughter and daughter-in-law.
All adult members of the family are involved in family agricultural activities. They have one milk cow, the dairy products of which are sold locally. In addition, the family owns 1.25 ha agricultural land where the following vegetables are grown: potato, cabbage, onion, garlic, and beet. Part of the harvested vegetables is sold locally to the retailers and the other part is sold on the open market in Akhaltsikhe (a nearby town).
With the requested loan, Anzor will purchase seeds for potatoes. This year he will plant more potatoes in comparison with the last years. It is caused by the increased price of the potatoes on the local market. Anzor hopes that their vegetables will be sold for a good price and he'll get his planned income. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the familys farming activities.

loan.use: to purchase seeds for potatoes

loan.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr: Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA 2 sont des femmes maries ayant une moyenne dge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles Konona, un situ environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA rgion de Sikasso, 3me rgion administrative du Mali. Ces clientes sont leur troisime cycle de prt de campagne avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prts antrieur Sont t rembourss avec satisfaction. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du mas, du riz, darachide, de gombo, de pois de terre, etc. MAYATOU compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 2 sacs dure 1 sac de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 20.000 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilise pour les dpenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of the BENKELEMA 2 group are married women who have an average age of 34 years and 5 children and live in large traditional families in Konona, located approximately 30 km from the commune of Niena in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative region of Mali. These clients are on their third loan cycle campaign with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the need for means of production and agricultural fertilizer. The previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, ground peas etc. MAYATOU plans to use her loan to buy two bags of urea, one bag of complex fertilizer and the remainder for labor and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 to 25,000 CFA which will be used for the familys household expenses.

loan.use: To buy agricultural fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loan.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has one child.
Ali has a shop selling used and new auto parts since 2007. He is experienced in this field, has a good reputation and is well known in his area.
He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his familys quality of life.

loan.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loan.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
Saltanat is a young leader of this group. She is 24 and married to a barman. Together they bring up a newly born child.
Two years ago, Saltanats husband received a livestock inheritance from his parents. In order to contribute additional money to the family budget, Saltanat breeds and resells livestock at the higher price. She started livestock breeding two years ago and during this period her business was successful. She earns 1500 soms per month. Saltanat decided to apply for the loan because she needs additional funds in order to increase her number of livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase an additional four animals for breeding. In the future, this young woman wishes to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to purchase four livestock animals.

loan.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is a 37-year-old farmer from the village of Tchvinta, in the southern part of Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Shorena, 13-year-old daughter, 2-year-old son and mother (retired). Grigol and Shorena lead the dairy farm of the family. They have three milk cows. They sell the dairy products from the cows on the local market. The total income of the family is 600 Laris per month, including the pension of Grigols mother.
With the requested loan, Grigol will purchase an additional milk cow. They will get more milk and increase the sales of the dairy products. An increase in income will allow the family to purchase more household goods in order to improve the familys living conditions.

loan.use: to purchase a milk cow

loan.name: Nabil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child.
Nabil has had a shop selling all kinds of chicken since 2010. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.
He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a chicken grilling machine and a chicken cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his familys quality life.

loan.use: To buy a chicken grilling machine and a chicken cleaning machine.

loan.name: Benkelema 3 Group

texts.fr: Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA 3 sont des femmes maries. Elles ont une moyenne dge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries, copouses et leurs enfants Konona, un village situ environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA rgion de Sikasso, 3me rgion administrative du Mali. Ces clientes sont leur troisime cycle de prt de campagne avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prts antrieurs ont t rembourss avec satisfaction. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du mas, du riz, darachide, de gombo etc. MARIAM compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 3 sacs dure 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 45.000 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilise pour les dpenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of Benkelema 3 are married women. They are on average 33 years old and have on average 5 children. They live with their husbands, cospouses and children in Konona, a village located about 30 km from the city of Niena in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. These clients are on their third loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production and agriculture ingredients. The previous loans were satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, etc. Mariam plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of urea and 2 bags of complex grains and the rest on labor and hoeing. She envisions making on average 45,000 50,000 FCFA, which will be used towards her familys daily needs.

loan.use: to buy agricultural ingredients and labor

loan.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. He lives with five family members; two of them work.
Karar has had a farm for cattle and calves since 2009. He worked in this field since he was child so he has a lot of experience. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.
He is requesting a $3,000 loan to build a cow barn. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his familys quality of life.

loan.use: To build a cow barn.

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene comes from the village of Minadze, Akhaltsikhe District. She lives with her two sons (15 and 20 years old) and mother-in-law (74 years old). Irene works as a cook in the local military office. Her salary is 155 Laris per month. Her younger son goes to school and the elder one serves in the army as a contractor. Along with her regular job, Irene also leads the agricultural business of the family: She cultivates 0.5 ha of the family-owned land and grows potatoes and other vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally. In addition, the family owns three milk cows and two calves. Irene produces traditional Georgian cheese from the gathered milk and sells it in the village.
With the requested loan, Irene will purchase calves to raise and sell in the fall for a higher price. The increase in profits will be used for equipping their house with new household goods, in order to make it comfortable.

loan.use: to purchase calves

loan.name: Altynai's Group

texts.en:
Altynai, 34, is a leader of this group. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both children are preschool age (under seven).
A year ago, with the initial investment of 3000 soms, the family started cultivating strawberries. They are engaged in the wholesale trade of strawberries. The monthly income from this kind of business is 12000 soms. Altynai applied for the loan because she needs additional money to repair an apartment. She hopes that the loan will help her improve the familys living conditions.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to repair an apartment.

loan.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old and married.
In 2000 Hasan opened a grocery store where he sells all kind of fruits, vegetables and juices. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.
He is requesting a $1700 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his familys quality of life.

loan.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loan.name: Benkelema 4 Group

texts.fr: Les 10 membres de BENKELEMA 4 sont des femmes maries ayant une moyenne dge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles largies Konona, un situ environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA rgion de Sikasso, 3me rgion administrative du Mali. Ces clientes sont leur troisime cycle de prt de campagne avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prts antrieurs ont t rembourss avec satisfaction. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du mas, du riz, darachide, de dah, de pois sucr, de gombo etc. ROKIA, la prsidente du groupe compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 1 sac dure et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilise pour les dpenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkelema 4 group are married women averaging 34 years of age, with five children, living in traditional extended families in Konona, a settlement about 30 km from the town of Niena, the Region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
These customers are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of having the necessary tools and agricultural inputs. The previous loans have been repaid in satisfactory manner.
This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts (ground nuts), bissap, sweet peas, okra etc. Rokia, the groups leader plans to use her loan to pay for one bag of urea [fertilizer] and other necessities, such as the costs of manual labor and weeding. [S]he envisages achieving an average monthly income of 10,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses.

loan.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and manual labor

loan.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 41 years old and he is married. He sells shoes. His business is well-organized and he has two years of experience. He currently employs one person to help him. His business operates from 6 am to 7 pm every day.
Moussa has requested a loan from kiva lender in order to purchase more women's shoes to sell. With this profit, he will reinvest in his business and save money for his future.

loan.use: to purchase more women's shoes to sell.

loan.name: Seiran

texts.en:
Seiran comes from the village of Tsira, in the southern part of the country. Seiran is 52 years old and married. He lives with his family his wife Manushak, two adult sons (25 and 30 years old), his daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (five and one year old).
Seiran is a taxi driver and earns approximately 450 Laris per month. Along with this job, Seiran also gets income from agricultural activities. In particular, he has a business raising calves. Also, with the assistance of his younger son, he cultivates family-owned 1-ha land and grows potatoes, maize and haricot beans, which are sold on Akhaltsikhe open market.
With the requested credit, Seiran will purchase calves, which will be raised on the farm. In fall they will be sold locally for a higher price.
Profit received from this business activity will be used for expansion of the family business.

loan.use: to purchase calves.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. She owns a small business selling milk, water and eggs. This business is well known and organized. She has one year of experience and she employees two people to help her.
Rose has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more milk, water and eggs to sell. Rose will be able to earn more profit. With this extra profit, she plans to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loan.use: to purchase more milk, water and eggs.

loan.name: Benkelema 5 Group

texts.fr: Les 7 membres du groupe BENKELEMA 5 sont des femmes maries qui ont une moyenne dge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles polygames Konona, un situ environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA rgion de Sikasso, 3me rgion administrative du Mali. Ces clientes sont leur troisime cycle de prt de campagne avec linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prts antrieurs ont t rembourss avec satisfaction. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du mas, du riz, darachide, de gombo etc. MARIAM F compte acheter, 3 sacs dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 45.000 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilise pour les dpenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en: The 7 members of the BENKELEMA 5 group are married women who are on average 33 years old with 5 children. They live in polygamous families in Konona, located approximately 30 km from the Niena commune in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative region of Mali. These clients are on their third campaign loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the need for means of production and agricultural fertilizer. The previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, etc. MARIAM plans to buy 3 bags of urea, 2 bags of complex fertilizer and use the remainder of the loan for labor and weeding costs. She expects to make an average profit of 45,000 to 50,000 CFA which will be used for the familys everyday expenses.

loan.use: To buy agricultural fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loan.name: Belle Fille Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Belle Fille est constitu de sept femmes qui sont maries, majoritairement dans des familles monogames, avec en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Sgou (4me Rgion administrative du Mali) et se sont connues travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parent. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de jus locaux, de porte feuilles, dencens et dhabits pour enfants. Dans le but daugmenter leurs fonds de commerce pour certaines et dentreprendre dautres activits gnratrices de revenus pour dautres, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de linstitution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont leur 1er cycle de prt solidaire. Madame Aminata a une grande rputation dans la fabrication - vente dencens dans son quartier et au march Chteau de Sgou. Elle compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 5 kg de Magnonkissni, deux flacons deau de Cologne et des parfums dont le choix se fait en fonction du got de la clientle. Elle se ravitaille en gros au grand march de Sgou en ces produits. Pour faire de lencens, on imbibe pendant 3 jours au moins le Magnonkissni dans leau de Cologne puis on lassaisonne avec des parfums. Ce produit obtenu est ainsi partag entre les bouteilles destines la vente en dtail, une clientle compose gnralement de femmes. Madame Aminata espre raliser avec ce prt un bnfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilis pour tre rinvesti dans lactivit et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif daugmenter le volume de son activit dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Belle Fille group consists of seven married women with an average age of 30 and 3 children. Most live in monogamous families. They all live in the Hamdallaye district of Sgou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship. The group members sell juice made from local fruits, pocketbooks, incense and childrens clothing. The group members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that some of them could increase their working capital and others could undertake new lines of businesses. They are on their 1st solidarity loan cycle. Aminata has a good reputation for making and selling incense in her neighborhood and at the Sgou Chteau market. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 kg of Magnonkissni (seeds of a wild plant), two bottles of eau de cologne and fragrances that are selected according to the tastes of her customers. She gets her supplies of these products wholesale at the Sgou Grand Market. To make incense, Magnonkissni is soaked in eau de cologne for at least 3 days, then fragrance is added. The product obtained is then divided among bottles that will be sold retail to a clientele composed for the most part of women. Mrs. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA from this loan which will be used to reinvest in the business and to take care of the familys everyday expenses. Her goal is to increase the volume of her business in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loan.use: To buy basic materials for making incense

loan.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is 51 years old and is married with 5 children. Zakiya sells various products such as beans and soap in her store. Zakiya has 1 year experience and she opens her business from 6.30am to 8.30pm every day. She employs two people to help her.
Zakiya has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more various products such as: beans and soap in her store. With the additional profits from this business, Zakiya will be able to pay school fees for her children and to reinvest in her business.

loan.use: to buy various products such as: beans and soap to sell in her store.

loan.name: Gazelle Group

texts.fr: Les sept femmes du groupe Gazelle sont maries majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 27 ans et 2 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Sgou (4me Rgion administrative du Mali) et se sont connues travers des liens de parent et de leurs activits gnratrices de revenu au march Chteau de Sgou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de pagnes wax, dhabits pour enfants, de chaises en bambou, du caoutchouc de lessive, du mil et des jus de fabrication locale. Dans le but daugmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont dcid dadhrer au programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont leur 1er prt solidaire. Madame Kadia compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 50 chaises en bambou avec des forgerons du village de Noumou Wr au grand march de Sgou lors des foires. Elle les revend en dtail une clientle compose de femmes et dhommes. Madame Kadia espre raliser avec ce prt un bnfice mensuel moyen de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilis pour tre rinvesti dans lactivit et assurer les soins de sant des enfants.
texts.en:
The majority of the seven women who make up the Gazelle group are married in monogamous families, with an average age of 27 and two children each. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Sgou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and are acquainted through kinship as well as business activities at the Chteau de Sgou market. The group's members sell "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth), children's clothing, bamboo chairs, rubber, detergent, millet, and locally made juice.
In order to increase their working capital, the group's members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their first group loan.
Madame Kadia plans to use her loan to buy fifty bamboo chairs from the blacksmiths of the Noumou Wr village at Sgou's big market during the fairs. She will sell them retail to a clientele composed of both men and women.
Madame Kadia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 22,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business and used to pay her children's health care.

loan.use: to buy bamboo chairs.

loan.name: Maksatbek

texts.en:
