Maksatbek is 40, married and has three children. He dreamed to be a lawyer and entered university, but because of the death of his father and necessity of taking care of his mother and family, he had to return to his native village. Today Maksatbek is engaged in cattle breeding and land-cultivating businesses, which were started in 1996. Also he practices working at the local sawmill in order to find an additional means of subsistence. He works hard and has managed to raise his initial capital from 30.000 KGS to floating capital in the sum of 100.000 KGS. Today his farm, which has amounted to two cows and twenty sheep, still needs to be developed. Maksatbek has applied for a loan of 100.000 KGS for purchasing cattle. With the revenues, he plans further development of his farm.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle.

loan.name: Kankeletigui 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 1 est une Association de femmes maries du village de Dembela dans la prfecture de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Le groupe est compose de 10 femmes qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-surs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide de riz et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour des frais de labours, acheter une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz des petits matriels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement au grand march de Dembela et de Nina ville. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail (souvent en gros), au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. YATA compte acheter, 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 30.000 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui 1 group is an association of married women from the Dembela village in the Niena prefecture, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group is made up of ten women who live in large, traditional extended families with their children, husbands, inlaws, etc. They have an average age of 34 and 5 children each. They farm peanuts, rice, and millet.
In order to make their agricultural operations profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This loan will be utilized to pay plowing costs and to buy rice and peanuts for planting, small farming equipment, and additional planting supplies, all at the big market of Dembela and the city of Niena.
After the rainy season, the harvests will be stocked in order to increase their value before being sold at the big market in Niena as well as surrounding markets, both retail and frequently wholesale, on a cash basis to clients generally from large cities.
Yata plans to buy 1 bag of carbamide and 2 bags of cereal fertilizer, and use the rest to pay for plowing and hoeing. He plans to make an average profit of 30,000 to 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay interest on the loan and for daily family expenses.

loan.use: to buy planting supplies and pay plowing costs.

loan.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 46, married and has two children. She worked as a nurse at the local hospital, but her wage was too low to cover her household expenses.
In 2001, in order to find an additional means of subsistence, she decided to engage in cattle breeding business. She started with purchasing one cow and managed to enlarge number of her cattle to two horses, two cows and ten sheep. Now this energetic woman plans to raise her monthly selling of milk products (which is about 4.500 KGS) by purchasing more milk cows. For this reason, Gulnara has applied for a loan of 100.000 KGS. With the revenues, she plans further enlargement of her business.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle.

loan.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, a 28-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of two and nines years, has been operating a well-organized business selling clothes for one year. Open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, she.employs one people to help her. Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes to sell, and plans to save for her family's future and to reinvest in her business with this profits.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loan.name: Kalya

texts.en:
Kalya is 58, widowed and has seven children. Six of them are grown and live on their own and one son, according to the Kyrgyz tradition, lives with her and helps in the household.
She started her business in breeding cattle and cultivating land with the initial capital of 6,000 KGS and manages to earn about 5,000 KGS in a month from selling milk and meat products.
Kalya has applied for a loan of 90,000 KGS to purchase bean seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the revenues, she plans to buy sheep, which will allow her to further broaden her business.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase seeds of beans and mineral fertilizers

loan.name: Kankeletigui 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 2 est une Association de femmes maries du village de Dembela dans le cercle de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Le groupe est compos de 10 femmes. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-soeurs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide de riz et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour acheter, une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz, payer les frais de labours, acheter des petits matriels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand march de Dembela et de Nina ville. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail (souvent en gros), au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. FANTA compte acheter ; 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Il envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 30.000 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui 2 group is an association of married women from the village of Dembela in the Niena area, Sikasso Region (the third administrative region of Mali). The group is composed of 10 women. They live in traditional extended families, together with their children, husbands, in-laws etc. They average 33 years of age, with at least four children.
They grow peanuts (ground nuts), rice and millet. In the desire to make their agricultural work profitable, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. The present loan will be use to purchase a sufficient quantities of peanut and rice seeds, pay the cost of manual labor, buy small tools and agricultural inputs at the ig market of Dembela and of the city of Niena. After the winter harvest, the produce is stocked away for a while until its value increases, and it is then sold at the big market of Niena and at the nearby markets , retail (often wholesale) for cash to customers usually coming from big cities.
Fanta plans to buy one bag of urea and two bags of complex fertilizers as well as to pay the cost of manual labor and weeding. [S]he envisages achieving a monthly income between 30,000 and 40,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover everyday family expenses.

loan.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and manual labor

loan.name: Kankeletigui 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 3 est une Association de femmes maries du village de Dembela dans lex cercle de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Le groupe est compose de 10 femmes. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-surs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide de riz, de pois sucr et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour payer les frais de labours, acheter une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz des petits matriels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand march de Dembela et de Nina ville. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail (souvent en gros), au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. DJENEBA compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 30.000 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: The Kankeletigui 3 group is an association of married women from the village of Dembela, in what was formerly Niena district, in Sikasso region, Mali's third administrative region. The group is composed of ten women. They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law and sisters in-law, etc. They are on average 33 years old with at least four children. They farm peanuts, rice, tiger nuts and millet. In order to make their farms more profitable, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. The current loan will be used to pay for plowing costs, and to purchase enough peanut and rice seeds, small equipment, and agricultural inputs (fertilizers) at the great markets of Dembela and Nina city. After wintering, harvests are stored for a certain time to ensure they gain value before being sold at Niena's great market and local markets, retailed or often sold wholesale to customers coming from big cities. Djeneba intends to use her loan to buy one bag of urea and two bags of complex fertilizer, with the remainder for plowing and weeding costs. She is planning on an average monthly benefit of 30,000 to 40,000 CFA, to be used to pay back the loan's interest and her family's daily expenses.

loan.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for plowing costs.

loan.name: Toma

texts.en:
Toma is from village Khevasheni. He is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife Darejan and two sons (26 and 20 years old).
The main source of income for the family is farming activities. In particular, Toma and his sons cultivate family-owned land with an area of 0.8 ha and grow potatoes, haricot beans and onions. Harvested vegetables are sold on Akhaltsikhe Market. Also, they run a dairy farm with seven milk cows and six calves. They produce cheese and sell it on Akhaltsikhe open market.
With the requested credit Toma will purchase two additional milk cows and the family will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will positively influence their income. The increase in the income will be used for renovation of the house, equipping it with new household goods.

loan.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loan.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara was born in the city of Naryn (in the Naryn region of the Kirghiz Republic). She is married with three grown children. She lives with her husband and is the guardian of two school-aged granddaughters. Tamara was the eldest daughter of a simple farm family. She spent most of her time doing household chores: looking after her younger sister, doing homework, and doing housework. When Tamara graduated from school she started studying sales at the Przhevalsky Vocational College (in the Issykulsky region of the Kirghiz Republic). There she met her husband, and she married when she was eighteen. In 1968, she had a son. That year they decided to move to Zhajylma village (in the Chujsky region of the Kirghiz Republic) where they got jobs as a milkmaid and as a tractor operator. The collective farm allocated them some land in the village to build a house. In 1970 and 1972 Tamara gave birth to two more daughters. Tamara's family did not immediately have a farm. On the land allocated to them by the state, they built a house and started the farm with cattle they had bred. In time, the two oldest daughters married and left home. Tamara had to sell part of their cattle to help support them. Presently, Tamara and her husband receive pensions and also work on the collective farm as watchmen. Now on her farm, Tamara has two bulls and ten sheep. Tamara plans to increase her cattle, and therefore is asking for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). Tamara dreams of further expanding the farm to create living conditions worthy of her family.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Kankeletigui 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 4 est une Association de 10 femmes toutes maries du village de Dembela dans le cercle de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-surs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide, des pois sucr, pois de terre de riz et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour payer des frais de labours, acheter une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz des petits matriels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand march de Dembela et de Nina ville. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail (souvent en gros), au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. SAFOURA compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 30.000 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui 4 group is made up of ten women, all married, from the village of Dembela, in the district of Niena, Sikasso region, in the third administrative district of the Republic of Mali. They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. On average, they are 35 years old with 4 children.
The women grow ground nuts, sugar peas, bambara peas, rice and millet. With the goal of increasing profitability, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program . The current loan will be used to pay labor costs, to buy enough ground nut seeds and rice, small equipment and intrants for cultivating, at the Dembela Grnad Market and the Niena town market. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a certain amount of time to increase in value before being sold and the Niena Grand Market and in the nearby markets, on a retail (sometimes wholesale) basis, for cash to customers who are mostly from the large towns.
Safoura plans to use her loan to buy one sack of urea, two sacks of complex cereal and the rest sill be used for labor and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 - 40,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay interest on the loan to to pay for the family's everyday expenses.

loan.use: to pay for agricultural intrants and labor costs

loan.name: Nakisunga Development Group

texts.en:
Norah, 37, is such a fascinating lady with a sparky sense of humor. The happily married mother of three likes to put smiles on people's faces.
She says getting into people's good graces is the key to maintaining good relationships, not only in business but in the other aspects of life. Striking the right impression in a client's mind as she transacts her pig sales business is what she considers her pivotal precept. Four years is the time she has been showing forth her worth, diligence and shrewdness in a business venture predominately run by men.
Norah, like many other enterprising young women in Uganda, is breaking that false stereotype about the inability of women in Uganda and the rest of Africa to run businesses such as these. She says she now knows the checkered experiences that come with running a business. She says in the near future, she will also confidently call herself a master at business.
Her first business was a retail shop, which she still operates. After much stock taking and consultations with friends and family, she decided she would have a crack at a pig sales business.
She has been making lots of headway in her business owing to the high demand for pork in Mukono Town, where she operates. The fact that she handles at least 10 to 25 clients a week is one of her business's selling points.
Norah has in this short period made tremendous strides. She anticipates further growth of her business once she gets this loan. She says once she expands her pig sales business to other areas like Kampala, she will be able to make more sales profits.
On the face of it, it is a decision she has never lived to regret. Weekly she says this business generates her profits to the tune of UGX 85,000.
Norah says with proceeds from this Kiva loan, she is going to purchase more piglets. Her plan is to nurture these piglets so that they grow sturdy and she can sell them at a higher price to her clients.

loan.use: to purchase more piglets.

loan.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 50 years old. He comes from village Kvenatkotsa, East Georgia. Khvicha is married and lives in the village with his wife Ketevan, two sons (21 and 20 years old) and his parents. All members of the family are involved in agricultural activities. They run a dairy farm with three milk cows, produce cheese and sell it on the open market. Also they rent 4.5 ha of land, where wheat, barley, maize, haricot beans and garlic are grown. Harvested products are sold locally. Also Khvicha has a modern multifunctional tractor which performs different types of agricultural tasks tilling, cultivation, sowing. He uses it in his farm, as well as carrying out orders of neighbor farmers. Total average monthly income of the family accounts to 1700 Laris.
With the requested credit Khvicha will purchase the plot of land with an area of 4.5 ha, for which he now pays rent - 600 Laris. This is quite a significant expense for the family. As a result of the purchase of land, the income of the family will increase, as they wont have to pay rent for the land.
With the increase in profit Khvicha plans to purchase more agricultural machinery, which will be used in his farm, as well as neighboring farms.

loan.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loan.name: Turgunbek

texts.en:
Turgunbek is 63 and married. He has two sons, the younger of whom is his main helper in cattle breeding business.
Turgunbek started it in 1995 with the initial capital of 5,000 KGS and managed to develop his household with monthly floating capital of 7,000 KGS. With the revenues, he was able to provide his family with essentials and buy more cattle.
Today his farm, which has two cows, 22 sheep, 10 goats and one horse, still needs to be developed. For this reason, Turgunbek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase more cattle. With the revenues, he plans further broadening of his business and in future, purchasing of a car for his family.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle.

loan.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 28-year-old farmer from village Pkhvenisi. Davit and his mother live in their house in the village. Davits mother is 72 years old and retired.
Davit has a milk cow whose milk is used for cheese production. Cheese is sold to the local retailer. Davit owns 4.7 ha of land. He grows approximately 12 tons of tomatoes and 14 tons of cabbage annually on this land. He has also planted 240 apple and 30 cherry trees. Vegetables and fruits are sold by Davit himself he takes them with his own mini-bus to the nearby towns and sells there. With the requested credit Davit will till and cultivate 1.4 ha of land, where cabbage, tomatoes and maize will be grown. Part of the credit will be used for purchasing fertilizers.
Davit hopes that after proper tilling of the land he will get a good harvest, which will be sold at a good price. With the received income Davit plans to renovate their house. In the near future, Davit is going to get married.

loan.use: to pay for tilling and cultivation of land and to purchase fertilizers.

loan.name: Kankeletigui 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 5 fait partie de lassociation de femmes maries du village de Dembela dans la prfecture de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Le groupe est compose de 10 femmes. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-surs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et au moins 3 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide de riz et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour payer les frais de labours, acheter une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz des petits matriels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement au grand march de Dembela et de Nina ville. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail (souvent en gros), au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. ALIMATA compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 15.000 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: The KANKELETIGUI 5 group is a member of the Dembela village association of married women in NIENA prefecture in the SIKASSO region, third administrative region of the republic of Mali. The group is composed of 10 women. They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. On average, they are 30 years old and have at least 3 children. They grow ground-nuts, rice and millet. With the goal of making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwasos loan program. The current loan will be used to pay for labor costs, to buy a sufficient quantity of ground-nut seed, rice, small tools and fertilizers for farming, exclusively at the Dembela Grand Market and in the town of Nina. After the rainy season, the harvests are stored for some time so that they have value before being sold at the NIENA Grand Market and in neighboring markets. The sales are in retail (often in wholesale), in cash to a clientele that come for the most part from large cities. ALIMATA plans to use her loan to buy 1 bag of urea, 2 bags of complex fertilizer and the remainder for labor costs and weeding. She expects to make an average profit of 15,000 to 20,000 CFA which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and for current family expenses.

loan.use: To buy agricultural fertilizer and pay for labor costs

loan.name: Kankeletigui 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 6 est une Association de femmes maries du village de Dembela dans la prfecture de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Le groupe est compose de 5 femmes, qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-surs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins 5 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide de riz et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour payer les frais de labours, acheter une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz des petits matriels et des intrants pour la culture au grand march de Dembela. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail, au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. ROKIA compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 15.000 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group KANKELETIGUI 6 is an association of married women from the village of Dembela in the prefecture of NIENA, Region of SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group is comprised of five women who live in large, traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. The group members average 31 years of age and five children each, and they grow peanuts, rice, and millet.
Concerned about make their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. At the main market of Dembela, the current loan will be used to pay for: labor for plowing; a sufficient quantity of seeds to plant peanuts and rice; sundry supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and the like for raising crops.
The crops are stocked up for a while, so that become valuable following the off-season. And then they are sold at the main market of NIENA and at surrounding markets. Cash or credit is accepted from a customer base of people from large cities in general.
ROKIA intends to spend her loan on: a sack of urea, 2 sacks of cereal-blend fertilizer, and the labor for plowing and weeding. She envisions making a monthly profit of 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover typical family expenses.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay for plowing

loan.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 29 years old, a farmer from village Ruisi, East Georgia. He lives with his wife Lia and 12-year-old daughter. Gela and Lia have 1.5 ha pf land where cabbage and beets are grown. After the harvest season, vegetables are sold to retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1600 Laris.
With the requested credit Gela will purchase fertilizers. After fertilizing, the quality and quantity of the harvest will increase, resulting in higher prices and thus higher income.
Part of the income from sales will be reinvested in the business and the other part will be used for finishing off the familys newly constructed house.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers for the farm.

loan.name: Kankeletigui 7 Group

texts.fr: KANKELETIGUI 7 est un regroupement de six femmes toutes maries du village de Dembela dans la prfecture de NIENA rgion de SIKASSO troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles largies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-surs etc. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles exercent la culture darachide de riz, des pois de terre, du pois sucr et de mil. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont dcid dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prt actuel sera utilis pour payer les frais de labours, acheter une quantit suffisante de semence darachide, de riz, des petits matriels, des intrants pour la culture, au grand march de Dembela. Aprs lhivernage, les rcoltes sont stockes pendant un certain temps pour quelles aient de la valeur avant dtre vendues au grand march de NIENA et dans les marchs environnants, en dtail (souvent en gros), au comptant une clientle venant gnralement des grandes villes. AWA compte utiliser son prt pour acheter, 1 sac dure, 2 sacs de complexe crale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice moyen de 15.000 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour le remboursement des intrts du prt et les dpenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
KANKELETIGUI 7 us a group of six women who are all married. They are from the village of Dembela in the prefecture of NIENA, Region of SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large, traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. The group members average 31 years of age and four children each, and they grow peanuts, rice, Bambara peas, sweet peas, and millet.
Concerned about make their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. At the main market of Dembela, the current loan will be used to pay for: labor for plowing; a sufficient quantity of seeds to plant peanuts and rice; sundry supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and the like for raising crops.
The crops are stocked up for a while, so that they become valuable following the off-season. And then they are sold retail for cash at the main market of NIENA and at surrounding markets to a customer base of people generally from large cities.
AWA intends to spend her loan on: a sack of urea, 2 sacks of cereal-blend fertilizer, and the labor for plowing and weeding. She envisions making a monthly profit of 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover typical family expenses.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay for plowing

loan.name: Twekembe Kikooza Group

texts.en:
Sarah, 36, is a business woman who has been reckoning on her tenaciousness, strong sense of purpose, will power and steadfastness to obtain a firm footing for her eight-year-old retail business in Mukono.
Sarah lays great value on hard work. She believes her diligence and her other virtues have brought her this far. Sarah says she got motivated to try her hand in this business on sensing the rising and unmet demand for many retail commodities. "Demand for goods such as maize flour, rice and beans was very high and I knew if I could get more of these in my shop, I would be in a safe bet situation." she says.
The eight years running this business have enabled her to learn many things about business: decision making, constant planning and how to keep a business afloat. Sarah says because she sells a wide variety of retail commodities at her shop, she attracts many new and old clients alike. This, in a broad sense, keeps her business up to the mark.
Her business, she says, will continue basking in the glow of better prospects once she uses this Kiva loan to purchase more retail commodities that are in high favor with many of her old and new clients.
She says that her monthly earnings are to the tune of UGX 600,000, and she says with this Kiva loan, she is going to purchase more retail commodities, such as rice, beans, plastics and maize flour to resell.

loan.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loan.name: C4371 Abahujimbaraga Group

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and is married. She has three children between the ages 5 and 11 years. She is the president of a group called Abahujimbaraga. She is in the middle who raise the hand.
Christine sells various goods such as rice, sugar, bread and biscuits. Christine employs two persons for help her and has been working for two years.
Christine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods such as beans, cassava, maize, rice, sugar, bread, etc to sell.
With this profits from the loan, Christine and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving.

loan.use: To expand her business by purchasing more beans, cassava, maize, etc.

loan.name: Euro Lenin

texts.es:
Euro Lenin tiene 75 aos de edad, es casado vive con la esposa y con los tres hijos de 29, 31 y 33 aos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Lenin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y en pocas cantidades siembra tomate de rbol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas de maz y de tomate, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es seguir trabajando y tener mas ingresos.
Lo que le gustara es que la tradicin no se pierda los hijos sigan trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Euro Lenin is 75 years old. Hes married and lives with his wife and three children, who are 29, 31 and 33 years old, in San Pablo Parish which belongs to San Miguel Canton.
The Unin y Esperanza (Unity and Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office. The members of this communal bank farm corn and potatoes and are merchants of vegetables and others.
Lenin is a farmer. Hes a corn farmer and also grows tree tomatoes (a small tree or shrub in the flowering plant family Solanaceae. It is best known as the species that bears the tamarillo, an egg-shaped edible fruit.) in small amounts. Hes been in this line of work for a long time. He does his purchases in San Miguel and sells his products at the farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
He requests the loan to buy corn and tomato seeds. The loan has helped him increase income and crop yields. He has faced challenges like the lack of laborers and weather variations which have sometimes damaged the crops. His dream is to continue to work and earn higher income. He would like it if the tradition werent lost and his children continued working in agriculture.

loan.use: to buy corn and tomato seeds.

loan.name: Ana Hilma

texts.es: Ana, se dedica a la venta D. dulces, calcomanias y ropa, inicio este negocio con el apoyo D. su esposo, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario fijo y lleva muchos aos D. dedicarse al negocio, su familia est conformada por su esposo y un hijo. Ella est solicitando prstamo para la compra D. prendas D. vestir como blusas, camisas, pantalones,tambien Juegos para nios y calcomanias, la compra le permitir incrementar el inventario, teniendo todo lo necesario para vender a los clientes. Su aspiracin es ser una comerciante en granD., crecer en el mercado, conociendo a ms clientes y en su hogar espera tener todo lo necesario para una vida digna junto a ellos.
texts.en:
Ana sells candy, decals and clothes. She started the business with help from her husband. She works on her own without a fixed schedule. Shes been in business for many years. Her family consists of her husband and son.
She is asking for a loan to buy articles of clothing like: blouses, shirts, pants, childrens outfits and decals. The purchase will allow her to increase her inventory having everything she needs to sell to her customers.
Her hope is to be a large merchant, to grow in the marketplace, know more customers and at home, she hopes to have everything necessary for a proper life with her loved ones.

loan.use: to buy clothes and decals.

loan.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 39 aos de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con 5 hijos de 23, 21, 17, 15, y 4 aos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Angela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz en pocas cantidades siembra papas y tambien se dedica al comercio de venta de lugumbres, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es comprar mas terreno para aumentar la produccion.
Le gusta trabajar en el campo, tejer ropa de lana y festejar las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
ngela is 39 years old, married, living with her husband and five children, who are 22, 21, 17, 15 and 4 years old, in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.
The Unin y Esperanza (Unity and Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office. Its members are corn and potato farmers and vegetable and others merchants.
ngela is a farmer. She grows corn and small amounts of potatoes. Shes also a vegetable merchant. Shes been in this line of work for a long time. She makes her purchases in San Miguel and sells her products in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
She is asking for the loan to buy seed and fertilizer. The loan has helped her increase income and crop yield. She has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and weather variations that occasionally have damaged the crops. Her dream is to buy more land to increase production.
She enjoys working in the fields, knitting wool clothes and celebrating Carnival.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loan.name: Moises Adali

texts.es: Moiss, vive con su familia, sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, todos trabajan en su familia, l es comerciante de medicina, este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de medicinas, antibiticos, analgsicos, vitaminas, esta compra le ayudara a tener abastecido el negocio, para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar los ingresos. Su aspiracin es montar su propio negocio en un lugar estratgico, incrementar la clientela y aportar para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Moiss is single. He lives with his family: parents and siblings. Everyone in his family works. He sells medicine, a business he carries out as a street vendor.
He is asking for a loan to buy medicines, antibiotics, analgesics and vitamins. This purchase will help him have his business stocked for his customers and to improve his income.
His hope is to set up a business of his own in a strategic spot, increase his clientele and provide his family with whats needed.

loan.use: to buy medicines, antibiotics, analgesics and vitamins.

loan.name: Marcial Leopoldo

texts.es:
Marcial Leopoldo tiene 52 aos de edad, vive en Union Libre vive con la compaera y con 6 hijos de 24, 22, 20, 18 11 y 8 aos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Marcial se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz en pocas cantidades papas, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas de maz y papas, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es construir la casa y comprar terrenos para seguir trabanjo.
Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval, salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Marcial Leopoldo is 52 years old and lives with his common-law wife. They have 6 children aged 24, 22, 20, 18, 11 and 8, and live in San Pablo parish, in San MIguel canton.
The "Unin y Esperanza" (Unity and Hope) community bank is located in San Pablo parish, 30 minutes from our San Miguel office. The members of this group are farmers who grow corn and potatoes. They also sell vegetables and other products.
Marcial is a farmer who grows corn in small quantities and also potatoes. He has been in this line of work for a long time. He makes his purchases in San Miguel and sells his products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
Marcial is requesting this loan to buy corn seeds and potatoes. This loan will help him to increase his income and production. He faces challenges in his work such as a lack of workers and changes in the weather which sometimes damage his crops. His dream is to build a house and buy land so that he can continue working.
Marcial enjoys celebrating carnival festivities and going out with his family.

loan.use: to buy corn seeds and potatoes

loan.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, l se dedica a la carpintera, este oficio lo inicio cuando trabaj en un carpintera, actualmente trabaja en lo propio y no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar. l solicita un prstamo para comprar madera, pegamento, barniz, clavos y ms materiales para la carpintera y elaboracin de muebles, esta compra le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para ejecutar sus pedidos y mejorar los productos a los clientes. Su sueo es tener un negocio amplio, con mayor cobertura, tener la oportunidad de distribuir para los comerciales de la zona.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his family, his wife and two children. He is in the carpentry business. He started this trade when he worked in a carpenter's workshop. Now he works in his own workshop and does not work fixed hours.
Luis is requesting a loan to buy wood, glue, varnish, nails and other materials he needs for his carpentry business and making furniture. This purchase will help him to have everything he needs to complete his orders and improve the products he makes for his customers.
Luis' dream is to have a large business with better coverage. He would like to have the opportunity to distribute his products to businesses in his area.

loan.use: to buy wood, glue, varnish and nails

loan.name: Wokulira Development Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old and has been running a grocery store in Mukono for the past seven years. She mostly sells watermelon, pineapples, soft drinks, and other items. The mother of six says that she has learned a great deal about many business fundamentals during this time. Her business goal is to find ways to improve and expand her business. Sarah has used her good relationship skills and work ethic to make significant strides. She believes that her business prospects will continue to expand as long as she maintains her unwavering attitude. Sarah says that she was prevailed upon by her husband to start her business. Prior to that, she made ends meet through teaching. She has not dispensed with teaching, although the remuneration for teachers in Uganda is not something one can talk of in the highest of terms. Sarahs weekly profits are approximately 60,000 UGX.
Sarah will use her portion of her Kiva loan to purchase more pineapples, jakefruit, watermelon and soft drinks to sell at her grocery store.

loan.use: to purchase fruit and soft drinks to sell

loan.name: Flor Alejandrina

texts.es: Flor, es soltera, vive junto a su madre, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio tiene 10 aos de existir, lo atiende de 6:00am a 7:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades en sus ventas. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, boquitas, huevos, pan, y otros ms que son necesarios, con este prstamo quiere fortalecer el negocio de los productos ms demandados por los clientes. Su objetivo es tener un negocio rentable, generar las ganancias suficientes para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Flor is single and lives with her mother. Her business is selling basic household products and she has been in this business for ten years. She works from 6.00am to 7.00pm. Up to now, she hasn't had any difficulties with her sales.
Flor is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, snacks, eggs, bread and other products that she needs. With this loan, she would like to strengthen her business by having available the products that her customers request the most.
Flor's goal is to have a profitable business and to make enough profits to cover her household expenses.

loan.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, snacks, eggs and bread

loan.name: Jose Elmo

texts.es:
Elmo tiene 43 aos de edad, es un hombre trabajador que vive con su esposa y tres menores hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe en Pacasmayo La Libertad. Elmo y su familia tienen una calidad de vida buena y estable.
Elmo se dedica al planchado y pintado de vehculos automotriz y cuenta con gran experiencia en este rubro. Elmo cuenta con clientela establecida y se siente satisfecho con la demanda que su servicio genera.
Elmo desea invertir en la compra de pinturas acrlicas y otras herramientas de trabajo que necesita, l cuenta con un plan de trabajo para prosperar en su actividad. Elmo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles para cumplir sus metas. l estara muy agradecido de concedrsele el crdito pues le sera de gran utilidad.
Elmo es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador que ha trabajado con nuestra entidad, cancelando adecuadamente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elmo is 43 years old, a hard-working man who lives with his wife and three minor children in the district of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo La Libertad. Elmo and his family have a good quality of life and stability.
Elmo dedicates himself to auto body repair and painting, and has a great amount of experience in this line of work. Elmo has an established customer base, and feels satisfied with the demand his service generates.
Elmo wants to invest into the purchase of acrylic paints and other tools of the trade that he needs. He has a business plan to prosper in his activity. Elmo requests a loan of 2000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to reach his goals. He would be extremely grateful for being granted the loan, as it would be very useful to him.
Elmo is an entrepreneurial and hard-working man who has worked with our entity and adequately made his payments.

loan.use: buy acrylic paints and other tools of his trade.

loan.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 44 aos de edad est casado y vive con su esposa y 5 hijos en el casero San Pedrillo en el distrito de Tambogrande Piura. Esta es una comunidad pequea y rural que no cuenta con todos los servicios bsicos. Sin embargo, esta lleno de gente pujante y trabajadora.
Luis se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, teniendo actualmente 38 de ellos. Cuenta con una experiencia de 9 aos en el rubro. Adems, es agricultor y tiene terreno agrcola en el cual siembra limn y mango, ambos frutales en produccin y bien conducidos. Complementariamente trabaja como pen agrcola en una quinta de 30 hectreas de mango que hay en el casero. Luis tiene gran conocimiento sobre ambas actividades y es por eso que tiene clientela fija que prefiere sus servicios y productos.
Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un prstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus 38 ovinos y para la fertilizacin de sus cultivos de mango y limn.
Luis es un cliente conocido para Edpyme Alternativa. Siendo este su segundo crdito, el primero lo cancel puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 5 children in the village of San Pedrillo, located in the district of Tambogrande Piura. This is a small and rural community that does not have many basic services. Despite this, it is full of people that thrive and work hard.
Luis dedicates himself to raising sheep, and currently has 38 of them. He has 9 years of experience in this line of work. In addition, he is a farmer and has land where he plants lemons and mangoes, both fruit trees in production and well managed. He carries out complementary work as a laborer on a 30-hectare mango farm located in the village. Luis knows a lot about both activities, which is why he has a steady customer base that prefers his services and products.
Luis requests a loan of 1500 new Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his 38 sheep, and for fertilizer for his mango and lemon crops.
Luis is a customer known to Edpyme Alternativa, as this is his second loan. He paid off the first loan punctually and responsibly.

loan.use: buy balanced feed for his sheep and fertilizer for his crops.

loan.name: Maribel Katerine

texts.es:
Maribel Katerine tiene 20 aos de edad, es soltera vive con los padres y un hijo de tres aos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Maribel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y crianza de pollos, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas de maz y comprar pollos, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es comprar un un terrreno y construir la casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pintar y dibujar paisajes.
texts.en:
Maribel Katerine is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and three year-old son in San Pablo parish, in San MIguel canton.
The "Unin y Esperanza" (Unity and Hope) community bank is located in San Pablo parish, 30 minutes from our San Miguel office. The members of this group are farmers who grow corn and potatoes. They also sell vegetables and other products.
Maribel is a farmer who grows corn and raises chickens. She has been in this line of work for a long time. She makes her purchases in San Miguel and sells her products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
Maribel is requesting this loan to buy corn seed and chickens. This loan will help her to increase her income and production. She faces challenges in her work such as a lack of workers and changes in the weather which sometimes damages her crops. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house.
In her spare time, Maribel enjoys painting and drawing landscapes.

loan.use: to buy corn seed and chickens

loan.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es una clienta de 26 aos de edad, es soltera y vive en casa familiar con sus padres y su hermana mayor, en l el casero Palominos ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande Piura, en una pequea comunidad rural que no cuenta con todos los servicios bsicos.
Georgina tiene 4 aos de experiencia en el negocio de comida marina que tiene en su propio domicilio, en el cual atiende los fines de semana y cuenta con clientela establecida que esta satisfecha con sus platos y servicios. Ella recibe el apoyo de su hermana mayor para realizar esta actividad. Sus padres cuentan son agricultores y Georgina tambin los ayuda en sus labores cuando no est atendiendo a sus clientes. Existe una buena relacin familiar.
Georgina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un prstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para hacer mejoras en su negocio y para comprar cervezas directamente desde el carro repartidor que las vende a precios ms asequibles. Es muy popular en el Per negocios como los de Georgina que son llamados picanteras, y en estos se venden principalmente ceviches y cervezas.
Este crdito ser de gran utilidad para Georgina, quien tiene deseos de ampliar su negocio y as poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
Georgina cuenta con un buen expediente de pagos, ya ha trabajado con nuestra institucin.
texts.en:
Georgina is a 26 year-old client. She is single and lives in her family home with her parents and her older sister. They live in the small village of Palominos which is in Tambogrande - Piura district. This is a small, rural community that does not have all the basic services.
Georgina has four years experience in cooking seafood. Her business is located in her own home and she works there on weekends. She has established customers who are satisfied with her dishes and her service. She receives support from her older sister in her business. Georgina's parents are farmers and she also helps them with their work when she is not serving customers. They have a good family relationship.
Georgina is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can make some improvements to her business and also buy beer directly from the delivery truck which offers more affordable prices. Businesses such as Georgina's are called 'picanteras' and they are very popular in Peru. They mainly sell 'ceviches' (pieces of raw fish marinated in citrus juice, served with sliced onions and chilis) and beer.
This loan will be really useful to Georgina as she has a desire to expand her business and thereby improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.
Georgina has a good credit history as she has already worked with our institution.

loan.use: to improve her business and buy beer

loan.name: Edenilson Alexander

texts.es: Edenilson, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 3 y un ao de edad, l tiene un taller de mecnica, tiene cuatro aos de tener el negocio y lo aprendi desde joven. Actualmente necesita invertir en el taller, comprando llaves y otras herramientas que le hacen falta para las reparaciones de los vehculos, al comprar estas herramientas estar brindando un mejor servicio a los clientes. Su aspiracin es tener un taller bien establecido, mejorar su trabajo y realizarlo con la mayor delicadeza, manteniendo satisfechos a los clientes y al mismo tiempo mejorando su condicin en el hogar.
texts.en:
Edenilson is married and has two children aged 3 and 1. He has an auto repair shop and has owned his business for four years. He learned the trade when he was young.
Edenilson currently needs to invest in his auto repair shop, buying wrenches and other tools that he needs to repair vehicles. By purchasing these tools, he will be able to provide a better service to his customers.
Edenilson's aspirations are to have a well-established business, to improve his work and carry it out with the greatest attention to detail, and to keep his customers satisfied. At the same time, he hopes to improve the condition of his home.

loan.use: to buy wrenches

loan.name: Oscar Martin

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 47 aos de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos menores. Esta casa est ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, es una comunidad pequea en vas de desarrollo y con gente emprendedora.
Oscar se dedica a prestar sus servicios de chofer de transporte pblico, en un vehculo que alquila diariamente desde hace ms de 15 aos. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Oscar darle alimento y educacin a sus hijos y a pesar de las adversidades l se siente confiado de que su realidad algn da cambiar.
Oscar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un prstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que utilizar para hacer arreglos dentro de su hogar y as poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. l estara sumamente agradecido si se le concede el prstamo, pues estos arreglos le son necesarios.
Oscar es un cliente recurrente para nuestra entidad y todos sus crditos los ha cancelado adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Oscar is 47 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and dependent children. His home is located in the rural area of Lambayeque district. He lives in a small, developing community whose people are entrepreneurial.
Oscar provides a public transport service in a vehicle that he hires every day. He has been doing this for more than 15 years. This business activity has allowed Oscar to provide his children with food and an education. In spite of the difficulties, he feels confident that one day his situation will change.
Oscar is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to make some repairs to his home so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life. He would be extremely grateful to receive the loan as these repairs are much needed.
Oscar is a long-standing client of our institution and he has repaid all his previous loans properly.

loan.use: to make some repairs to his home

loan.name: Alder

texts.es:
Alder es un joven trabajador de 26 aos de edad. l vive con su novia y pequeo hijo de 3 aos en casa propia, en una comunidad pequea y rural en vas de desarrollo, perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque
Alder se dedica, desde hace 3 aos, a la crianza y comercializacin de animales en un casero ubicado del distrito de Mrrope ubicado a 45 minutos de Lambayeque.
Alder solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un prstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de una res y de otros animales menores (patos, pavos). Adems, l desea comenzar a vender pollos en su localidad.
Alder tiene la perspectiva de aumentar su ganado vacuno comprando reses, de tal manera que le permita generar mayores ingresos y poderle dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia. l tiene muchos deseos de superacin y este prstamo le sera de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Alder is a hard-working young man of 26. He lives with his girlfriend and his 3 year-old son in his own home which is located in a small, rural, developing community in Lambayeque district.
For three years, Alder has been raising and selling animals in a small village in Mrrope district, 45 minutes from Lambayeque.
Alder is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying a cow and other animals (ducks and turkeys). He would also like to start selling chickens in his village.
Alder plans to increase his herd of cattle by purchasing cows which will allow him to make more income and provide his family with a better quality of life. He has a great desire to improve himself and this loan will be very useful to him.

loan.use: to buy a cow and other animals

loan.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo, est casado, tiene dos hijos, se dedica al cultivo de maz y tambin tiene un taller de mecnica, estas ocupaciones son las que le dan a Eduardo los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. El est en proceso de iniciar el cultivo de maz, por lo que solicita un prstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para suelos, con estos materiales preparara el terreno y cultivara la milpa. Su objetivo es tener ocupaciones que le generen ganancias para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has two children. He grows corn, and he also has a mechanics shop. These are the businesses that give Eduardo the income to cover the household necessities.
He is in the process of starting to plant corn. That is why he is requesting a loan. The loan is to buy fertilizer and soil treatments. He will use these materials to prepare the land, and he will cultivate the cornfield.
His objective is to have businesses that generate earnings to cover the household necessities.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and soil treatments.

loan.name: Manfredy

texts.es: Manfredy, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con su familia, l se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, tiene 2 aos de realizar esta actividad, aprendi por iniciativa propia, trabaja solo cuatro das al mes que es el da de comercio realizado cada martes. El necesita comprar ganado por lo que solicita un prstamo y invertirlo en tres terneros, estos los crecer por un tiempo para luego comercializarlos, con esta compra estar creciendo en su comercio. Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso, con la que pueda ayudar a su familia y ahorrar para su futuro.
texts.en:
Manfredy is single, and he does not have children. He lives with his family. He has been buying and selling livestock for two years. He learned this through his own initiative. He only works four days a month as he conducts his business every Tuesday.
He needs to buy livestock, which is why he is requesting a loan. He will buy three calves. They will grow for a while, and he will later sell them. With this purchase he will be growing in his business.
His objective is to have a source of income with which he will be able to help his family and save for the future.

loan.use: to buy three calves.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy merchandise for her retail clothing business.

loan.name: Jesus Benjamin

texts.es:
Jess tiene 41 aos de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, en una comunidad pequea con muchos deseos de superarse.
Jess se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, que luego comercializa alrededor de su distrito. Adems, cuenta con terreno agrcola en el cual siembra limn semanalmente y que actualmente se encuentra en produccin. Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral y siempre apoya a Jess en sus actividades. En este hogar prima una buena relacin familiar que ayuda a sus integrantes a desarrollar sus labores.
Jess solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un prstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus ovinos. As mismo, comprar fertilizantes y har labores de deshierbo para sus cultivos de limn. Esto le permitir seguir creciendo en sus negocios y poder llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jess is 41 years old and lives with his wife and son in a rural part of Tambogrande district. He lives in a small community which has a great desire to improve itself.
Jess raises sheep which he then sells around his district. In addition, he has farm land where he grows lemons every week and which is currently producing. His wife raises poultry and always supports Jess in his work. There is a good family relationship in this household which helps them in their work.
Jess is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy balanced feed for fattening his sheep. He will also buy fertilizers and do weeding work on his lemon crop. This will allow him to continue growing in his businesses and achieve a better quality of life.

loan.use: to buy balanced feed and fertilizers

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy oil, sugar, sausages, soft drinks, toilet paper, and soap.

loan.name: Kyaterekera Development Group

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old and married. She and her husband do not yet have children. Betty earns an income from two businesses she sells pigs and coffee. She operates both businesses in Mukono. Betty also has a small poultry business that she oversees. Her businesses can be highly profitable provided one invests in them. Betty is trying her best to succeed in her business ventures. Over the last nine years, she has been investing time and money in her businesses and the impact has been showing in her increasing number of clients. Betty has built a reputation of nothing but hard work. She says she was inspired by her husband to get established and she makes a monthly profit of 300,000 UGX.
With her Kiva loan, Betty will purchase more pigs and bags of coffee to sell.

loan.use: to purchase pigs and coffee to sell

loan.name: C4372 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Euphrasi is 43 years old and is married with five children between the ages of five and 17. She is the president of a lending group called "Twitezimbere" in the local language. Euphrasi is in a yellow dress on the right and is raising her hand.
Euphrasi and her team have requested a Kiva loan through the Vision Finance Company. For the past year, Euphrasi has run a butcher shop. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase materials for her shop such as a table, a balance scale, and other items. With the profits from her loan, Euphrasi will save for her family and to build a house.

loan.use: to purchase materials for her shop such as a table and scale

loan.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 61 aos de edad, es soltero vive con parientes tiene 6 hijos todos son casado, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y en pocas cantidades siembra tomate de rbol, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas de maz y de tomate, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es comprar terrenos.
Le gusta festejar todas las fiestas del ao.
texts.en:
Manuel is 61 years old, single and living with relatives. He has six married children. They live in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.
The Unin y Esperanza (Unity & Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office. The members of this communal bank are corn and potato farmers and sell vegetables and others.
Manuel farms corn and small amounts of tree tomatoes. Hes been in this occupation for a long time. He makes his purchases in San Miguel and his sales take place in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
He is asking for a loan to buy corn and tomato seeds. The loan has helped him increase income and production. He has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and variations in the weather that occasionally have damaged crops. His dream is to buy land. He enjoys celebrating all the annual festivals.

loan.use: to buy corn and tomato seeds.

loan.name: Guadalupe Herminia

texts.es: Guadalupe, vive con su esposo y un hijo D. 26 aos D. edad, ella se dedica al comercio D. calzado y ropa, dicho negocio lo tiene instalado en el mercado municipal, su horario D. atencin es D. 6:00am a 6:00pm, lo inicio hace 20 aos. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra D. blusas, faldas, camisas formales, pantalones, tambin zapatos formales y tacos D. futbol. Esta inversin le ayudara a crecer, ofrecer ms mercadera a los clientes y esto le servir para crecer como comerciante. Sus aspiraciones es tener el negocio fortalecido en ropa y calzado, mantener a los clientes satisfechos y D. esta manera mejorar la condicin econmica D. su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives with her husband and a 26-year-old son. She sells footwear and clothes in a business located in the municipal market. She is open from 6am until 6pm and started it 20 years ago.
She is asking for a loan to buy blouses, skirts, formal shirts, pants and formal shoes and football cleats. This investment will help her grow; she will offer more merchandise to the customers and this will help her grow as a merchant.
Her goals are to have a strong clothing and footwear business, to keep her customers happy thus improving her familys economic condition.

loan.use: to buy blouses, formal shirts and shoes and football cleats.

loan.name: Walter Ivan

texts.es:
Walter Ivan tiene 30 aos de edad, vive en union libre vive con la compaera y con los 4 hijos de 9, 5, 4 y 3 aos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y choclo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas de maz y choclo, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es comprar terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte como el indor y festejar las fiestas .
texts.en:
Walter Ivan, 30, lives with his partner and their four children who are 9-, 5-, 4- and 3-years old, respectively. They live in San Pablo parrish in the Ecuadorean canton of San Miguel.
The members of the UNION Y ESPERANZA community bank meet in San Pablo, some 30 minutes from our office in San Miguel. The members of the bank are famers. They grow maize, potatoes and vegetables, among other crops.
Walter grows maize and corn. He's built his farm over many years. He buys supplies in San Miguel and sells his products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
Walter is applying for a loan to buy seeds for his next maize and corn crop. The loan will help him increase his production and, in turn, his income. The challenges he faces include a shortage of workers and vagaries in the weather that damage his crops. His dream is to buy land.
Walter likes to watch sports and go to local festivals.

loan.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loan.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es: Fanny, vive con su esposo, una hija y sus suegros, su hija tiene dos aos de edad, tiene un negocio donde vende pupusas y refrescos, este surgi por el apoyo de su esposo y su suegra, trabaja por las tardes, en las maanas le ayuda a la suegra en el negocio de venta de tortillas y por el momento necesita un crdito para fortalecer el negocio de las pupusas. Su inversin ser en bebidas, refrescos, maz, chicharrn, quesillo y condimentos, esta compra le permitir contar con todos los materiales necesarios para la preparacin de su venta, y continuar as ofreciendo un buen servicio a los clientes. El sueo de ella es ser una microempresaria con un negocio rentable, de esta manera generar ingresos que cubran las necesidades de su familia y les permita tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Fanny lives with her husband, a daughter and her in-laws. Her daughter is two years old. She has a business selling pupusas (typical Salvadoran fast food) and beverages. The business started with help from her husband and mother-in-law. She works afternoons. In the morning she helps her mother-in-law in her business selling tortillas. She needs a loan to strengthen the pupusa business.
Her investment will be for beverages, soft drinks, corn, fried pork skin, cheese and condiments. This purchase will help her have on hand all the necessary ingredients to prepare her items for sale and to continue offering good service to her customers.
Her dream is to become a micro businesswoman with a profitable business to generate income that will cover her familys needs and allow them to have a dignified life.

loan.use: to buy beverages, soft drinks, corn, fried pork skin, cheese and condiments.

loan.name: Ramona Maria

texts.es:
Ramona Maria tiene 43 aos de edad, es casada vive con la esposa e hijos, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantn San Miguel.
Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.
Ramona se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol, morocho un poco de papas y trigo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.
Solicita el crdito para la compra de semillas de frejol, morocho un poco de papas y trigo, el crdito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la produccin, ha enfrentado desafos como la falta de trabajadores y el variacin del clima que en ocasiones a daado los cultivos. Su sueo es comprar mas terrenso para seguir sembrando y cultivar otros productos.
Lo que le gusta es festejar las fiestas del carnaval y trabajar para tener dinero.
texts.en:
Ramona Mara is 43 years old, married and living with her husband and children. They live in San Pablo Parish belonging to San Miguel Canton.
The Unin y Esperanza (Unity & Hope) communal bank is located in San Pablo Parish 30 minutes from the San Miguel office. The members of this communal bank are corn and potato farmers and sell vegetables and others.
Ramona farms corn and beans, a bit of potatoes and wheat. Shes been in this occupation for a long time. She makes her purchases in San Miguel and her sales take place in farmers markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.
She is asking for a loan to buy bean seeds, corn, some potatoes and wheat. The loan has helped her increase income and production. She has faced challenges like the scarcity of laborers and variations in the weather that occasionally have damaged crops. Her dream is to buy more land to continue working and plant other crops.
She enjoys celebrating Carnival and working to earn money.

loan.use: to buy bean seeds, corn, some potatoes and wheat.

loan.name: Agip Women's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old and happily married with four kids. She is a trained nurse and for the past nine years has been operating a medical clinic in Mukono. Her nursing training is very important in her business. With determination, hard work and prayers, Margaret has made substantial progress. She earns a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 UGX.
Margaret will use her portion of this group loan to purchase drugs and medical equipment to use in her clinic.

loan.use: to purchase drugs and medical equipment to use in her clinic

loan.name: Mara Del Carmen

texts.es: Mara del Carmen, D. 69 aos D. edad, vive con su compaero D. vida y sus dos hijos los cuales reciben educacin en una escuela cercana a la localidad donD. residen. Ella posee una tienda con la que logran mantener su hogar, se levanta desD. muy temprano a vender en su tienda pues piensa que el trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicacin son las mejores armas para salir adelante y poder ser feliz junto a su familia. Mara se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues en su tienda las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan a un precio accesible; adems el lugar es muy higinico y reciben la atencin que se merecen, sus ganas D. sobresalir la han motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crdito que le permita abastecer su tienda con bebidas, sopas instantneas, golosinas, pan, granos bsicos entre otros. D. esta manera podr mantener y sacar adelante su negocio y podr darle a su familia una vida ms digna con seguridad econmica.
texts.en:
Mara del Carmen, 69, lives with her lifes companion and two children who are going to school near home. She has a store that she supports her family with. She rises very early to sell in her store because she feels that work, effort and dedication are the best weapons to get ahead and to be able to be happy together with her family. Mara has a large number of customers because they find what they need in her store at a reasonable price. Besides, the place is very hygienic and they receive the attention they deserve.
Her wish to stand out has motivated her to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to stock the store with beverages, instant soups, snacks, bread and basic grains, among others. This way she will be able to maintain and succeed with her business and proviD. her family with a more dignified, financially secure life.

loan.use: to buy beverages, instant soup, snacks, bread and basic grains.

loan.name: Jose Hernaides

texts.es: Jos, se dedica a la venta y reparacin de celulares y sus accesorios, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de 4 aos de edad, Jos inicio trabajando con un amigo, luego se independizo y puso su propio negocio desde hace 6 aos. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de mercadera, protectores, carcasas, bateras, cargadores y todo tipo de accesorios, este prstamo ser una gran ayuda para el negocio y poder brindar un mejor servicio. Su objetivo es crecer en su negocio, crear estabilidad y un mejor servicio a los clientes, tambin mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Jos sells and repairs cell phones and their accessories. He lives with his wife and they have a 4-year-old son. Jos started working with a friend but he later became independent and opened his own business six years ago.
He is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise: protectors, cases, batteries, chargers and all sorts of accessories. This loan will be a great help for his business and to be able to offer better service.
His goal is to grow in business, to create stability and better customer service as well as to improve his familys condition.

loan.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loan.name: Brisimi

texts.es:
